ReviewText: I took an adult ballet class here, on a drop in basis. Easy registration process, extremely reasonable pricing, considering the studios are excellent spaces, great floors, live piano accompanists, and, dance teachers who have serious credentials. The instructor for the ballet class I took was Heather Hawk - fantastic teacher. She gave individual corrections, demonstrated for us, was encouraging and positive, and, gave clear instructions. There were only 7 of us in the class. I am convinced that the studio I was in is the same studio in a scene from When Harry Met Sally, where Sally is taking tap class. It was an absolute treat to be able to take this class. I highly recommend Steps on Broadway to anyone seeking high quality dance classes for ballet and any other dance form.
ReviewTitle: Legendary Establishment * Great Drop-in Classes * Fantastic Teachers * Reasonable Prices
ProviderLocation: 2121 Broadway , 3rd Floor , New York City , NY 10023

ReviewText: My friend and I decided to take an impromptu Int/Adv ballet class after an audition. They had very nice staff and were helpful. I love the piano accompaniment. It brings be back to my youth. I would definitely recommend classes.
ProviderLocation: 2121 Broadway , 3rd Floor , New York City , NY 10023

ReviewText: We were recommended Steps by our dance studio. Our 13 year old has been dancing for almost 11 years and walked in to take a tap class. It was mid summer and people were vacationing so she received a semi private lesson and learned a lot! She had a great time!
ProviderLocation: 2121 Broadway , 3rd Floor , New York City , NY 10023

ReviewText: This is a dance institution, a mecca of sorts. Gelsey Kirkland trained and taught here (please read Dancing on My Grave ASAP if you haven’t already). Steps has a user friendly website for easy registration and purchasing of classes. Class schedule is conveniently posted and you can search/sort by date, dance style, etc. There are many dance styles and levels to choose from. I took a Sunday morning ballet class. This isn't a glitzy place, a little old school even, but it is a true dance studio with excellent classes and teachers. In my classroom, I felt like I was in a scene from The Turning Point. Bring water! It can get really warm in the rooms. Class was excellent and gave me a great workout. There is a little onsite café for snacks and beverages, and a small merchandise store. Great experience! Can’t wait to take class there next time I’m in NYC.
ReviewTitle: Dance Your Heart Out at Steps on Broadway
ProviderLocation: 2121 Broadway , 3rd Floor , New York City , NY 10023

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: This excellent panel discussion introduced us to 92Y programs. It exceeded our expectations. All panel members were articulate, astute & passionate about their " entrepreneur ship". We subsequently signed up for two more programs.
ReviewTitle: .Social Entrepreneur ship in the Age of Atrocities
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: The 92Y Harkness Dance Center offers an array of performances, classes, workshops and intensives. It is one of the premier presenting organizations in NYC due to its breadth and depth of dance/movement categories and techniques.
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: We visited for a very busy event. Kirsten Gillibrand interviewed Cory Booker. Even though there were loads of people there, the staff handled the crowds very well. The seats are bit tight, as most old theaters are, but it was a good experience.
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: Attended event in performance space. In lobby, saw signs for upcoming events & classes. Wish lived in area, could be busy every day.
ReviewTitle: Lively bldg., great architecture & good programmng
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: Gil Shaham is one of the best violinists in the world. His rendition of Bach was extraordinary. I found that the video presentation that was shown on the screen behind him a distraction. Far from adding anything to the performance, it was a source of annoyance. The pictures had nothing to do with the music and were mostly ugly to boot. Mr Shaham's playing does not need any enhancement to begin with and this show would not have enhanced anyone's performance. I can only assume that Mr. Shaham was being charitable in giving the person who prepared the video a chance to be seen.
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: I had a great experience at 92nd Street Y when I had the pleasure of attending the event 'Richard Lewis in conversation with JB Smoove' back in May. The venue was intimate and the atmosphere relaxed. Coming from the UK and being a big fan of 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' it was a great experience to see these two comedians in revealing conversation. The next time I visit New York I will definitely check out the schedule and hopefully catch another event here.
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: Was just at a lecture by Rabbi Lord Jonathan Sacks about his book "Not in God's Name". He is a brilliant and engaging speaker and it was an amazing talk. After his lecture, he had a sit-down with Eliza Griswold (a journalist) and then took questions from the audience. This is just one of many brilliant and entertaining speakers that the 92nd Street Y hosts. I always check their schedule for upcoming events.
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: This is the first time I've been to this venue. It's beautiful, holds about 850 people, and the seats are comfortable. I sat in the balcony and was able to see Joan Osborne and Mavis Staples from my seat. They were great by the way.
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: The Emilio and Gloria Estefan Q&A lead by the fab Rita Moreno was purely amazing! It was great to see them all interact with each other and learning more about how their career's started was nice. Thumbs up to the 92nd Street Y for this one.
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ProviderName: 92nd Street Y Tisch Center for the Arts
ReviewText: The 92nd Street Jewish Y is an historic Manhattan institution. It hosts a series of lectures, concerts, dances, talks, classes, and workouts in a large building on East 92nd Street. These events can range from hyper intellectual talks by world luminaries including Nobel Prize winners, to popular and classical music concerts, and foodie demonstrations among many others. We attended a lecture and discussion with two art world leaders that were stimulating, yet very funny at times. At the end of the year, we are going to attend a lecture on Picasso by John Richardson, who is the world's leading authority on Picasso. Whether you are a visitor or a local, please check out the program calendar; I bet that there will be a event or two of interest to you! The fees are very reasonable for such quality. Easy access from the 4, 5, or 6 trains.
ReviewTitle: One of the great, small cultural resources In Manhattan
ProviderLocation: 1395 Lexington Ave , New York City , NY 10128

ReviewText: I HAD to take a SC class while in NYC. It was my first time and it was fantastic. The staff made sure I knew what I was getting into, and the instructor helped me the entire time during the class itself. It was an hour of massive amounts of sweat but you cannot beat the energy! Afterwards I went to the shower facilities. This blew my mind. Maybe I am used to my normal gym but the showers were very private, provided soap, shampoo and conditioner. Hair dryers, hair spray, lotion, etc was all provided. I had a great experience here. & I loved that I could take the class, shower and put myself together to get back out and explore NYC. Thanks Soul Cycle, I'll be back!
ReviewTitle: Amazing energy - even better locker room!
ProviderLocation: 77th St and Amsterdam NYC , New York City , NY

ReviewText: On a visit last year my daughter treated me to this place. This time I treated my husband. We both loved it! There is nothing quite like the energy generated by this place!
ReviewTitle: My second visit and it was great!
ProviderLocation: 77th St and Amsterdam NYC , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We went to the 63rd studio, staff was amazing, Rachel was the instructor - fantastic, everyone was super helpful with instructions for us being new, amazing ride, would return again in a minute!!!
ProviderLocation: 77th St and Amsterdam NYC , New York City , NY

ReviewText: If you like spinning, you will love Soul Cycle. We went to the E63 location. It smelled clean and fresh, which was a surprise! They efficiently clean the bikes after each class and have a towel ready for you on the bike. It mixes weights in at the end, which really maximized the ride! If you want to burn some pizza off, take a class here! First time riders were cheaper, too.
ProviderLocation: 77th St and Amsterdam NYC , New York City , NY

ReviewText: If you are looking for a good workout, want something inspirational and only want to spend 45 minutes, this is the place to go. With several studios around NYC and for the price of 2 drinks, you can change your day and maybe even your life. I went every day on my business trip and couldn't say enough to recommend this cycling studio. Try it!!!
ProviderLocation: 77th St and Amsterdam NYC , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Soul cycle is a spinning studio with various locations in NYC. They are all equally good if you love to spin. It's a lot of spin and a bit of dance on the bike along with the music. The early morning and evening classes get booked up fast. Although they are expanding nationally now, this is definitely a true NYC workout experience. (Note you can buy single classes or a pack of classes)
ReviewTitle: If you love to spin, take a soul class
ProviderLocation: 77th St and Amsterdam NYC , New York City , NY

ReviewText: I am a seasoned spinner but this was the next level up including the cycling shoes ( for us travelers) towels and sanitized bikes.. as well as 4 customer service reps helping us on a very busy Saturday. I am in a service (health care) industry and was very impressed with time and compassion they showed. The classes themselves and instructors were top notch with great bikes, music and motivational workouts.. I wish I lived in NYC as I would be there every day!!! I have purchased a pass so I and my college daughter can ride when I am down there. GREAT JOB soul cycle I KNEW it was for me
ProviderLocation: 77th St and Amsterdam NYC , New York City , NY

ReviewText: If only once in your lifetime; see the NYC Ballet; it is an unforgettable transformative & transcendent experience of heavenly proportions. Hear and see music coming alive as no other symphonic or orchestral experience creates; not even opera.
ReviewTitle: See the Music Transformed to DANCE
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: The quality of the performances here are always as impressive as the setting. The whole place is well laid out and the staff are helpful. There is usually an interesting exhibition to see before the show. I just wish the drinks list was as impressive - other places manage better variety and quality. But it does not detract from what is a great evening out overall.
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Living in NYC, I usually look to Broadway whenever I need to transport myself to another time, another place, or to simply listen to a good story. Having spent close to 8yrs here, I recently decided it was time to look to other New York institutions for entertainment. This weekend I treated myself to a ballet matinee and found myself completely blown away by the experience. First of all, the David Koch theater, located in Lincoln Center, is stunning which is a treat in and of itself. But on top of that, I found the ballet to be so beautiful, the dancing to fluid and graceful, that I was completely mesmerized for the full 2hrs, which went by so quickly it was almost like a dream. The performance I watched was La Sylphide, and it was everything you need in a story- romance, unrequited love, witches and fairies. It was followed by a set of what seemed to be more classic dance routines which were just as beautiful. All in all, it did not disappoint and I can assure that I will be going back for more before the season is over! A tip to those not looking to break the bank, I sat in the 3rd tier and had a perfect view of the stage. So don't worry about being to high up. In fact, this may be better as it gives you a better angle.
ReviewTitle: Let the beauty and grace transport you
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: My husband, daughter, sister, mother, daughter and I enjoyed two beautiful performances on a very cold Valentines Day. The NYC ballet is always a good idea. Just beautiful.
ReviewTitle: Lovely way to spend Valentines Day
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We subscribe and, after exchanging some tickets to avoid ballets we don't care for or see ones we are especially interested in, we very rarely have a disappointing evening. Balanchine one of the less than handful of Protean geniuses of the last century in a league with Picasso and arguably Matisse. The range and his work still astonishes and some of the new works by living choreographers are interesting and rewarding, as are some non-Balanchine standards. The company's repertory and quality of dancing render this company without compare. Also, a good opportunity to dress up or not!
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: My husband bought us tickets for our anniversary! He bought them for a ballet 5 months ahead of time so that he could hand pick the most ideal seats. We were so excited and had been looking forward to seeing this ballet for months! The day of the ballet finally came (January 26) and there was a blizzard! But since they were non refundable tickets we decided to go anyway. We checked our email several times with no hint of the ballet being cancelled. It was not until we showed up 20 minutes early that we were told that it had been cancelled! You can imagine the frustrations! Then about 7 minutes after the show was to begin we got the email that the performance had been cancelled! I understand they do not control the weather, HOWEVER all of us not wanting to loose our money still showed up for the program! Then to top it all off today I tried to reschedule our ballet tickets. I was told I could pick the day and would have absolutely NO choice on my new seats! So a word to the wise.... DO NOT EXPECT ANY COURTESY FROM THIS COMPANY FOR ANY SITUATION! They do not cancel the program in a timely manner NOR make any accommodations for the extreme inconvience! Oh but you can always donate the value of your tickets to them in stead of rescheduling.....how very kind!!!!
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: What a BEAUTIFUL performance!! This is a perfect way to celebrate with the family! Highly recommend!
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Ever since I saw this as a child at a much smaller venue I have wanted to see it performed by the best dancers in the US. It was still magical even as an adult. It was a fantastic evening and the dancers were amazing.
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: The New York City Ballet is packed full of talent. I got to see them perform at the Lincoln Center which was a great treat!
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Absolutely wonderful evening. Superb from beginning to end! A must for the holiday season. Drinks are expensive but that's to be expected although no more so than most bars I guess. Very helpful staff. Beautiful theatre.
ReviewTitle: The Nutcracker Final Performance is a show stopper
ProviderLocation: Lincoln Center's New York State Theater , 66th St. , New York City , NY

ReviewText: I've been to the Copa many times for salsa dancing. People have to understand this is a dance club. Don't expect any seating and services. Must check your coat and bag for $3.00, cannot bring your own water. There are lots of salsa dancers all different levels. You can bring your own dance partner or find one easily. The classes are very basic. Usually there are buffets early in the evening. If you get there early, the price is very reasonable (from free to $5.00 $10.00 depend on the activity). Best for group celebration. It's a great place to have fun!
ReviewTitle: Great spot for Salsa dancing, bring your dancing shoes
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Went for New Years paid 260 for my fiancé and I. I was so excited to ring in the new year in what people say is the hottest club in NYC. After waiting OUTSIDE for almost 2 hours to get in because they say get there by 7 We got there at 6:15pm and went to one line then they made us got to another one. We waited in that one and did not get in until quarter after 8. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS. Open bar 4 hours- well less then that since we got in AFTER 8. That was a joke anyway it was cheap liquor and they didn't even carry or make half decent drinks. Bartender continued ignoring us at the bar. It was said floors 2 and 3 for general admission. We were stuck on ONE floor. Not at all what I paid for. Also said we would get New Years stuff I got a headband and the husband didn't get anything because they ran out of hats. When my husband asked if he could go outside and smoke they said ask security and security said not right now. The buffet was the only thing that surprised me to be half decent. The food was good but it was cold because they opened the stuff around 8:20 but nobody could eat until 9. As I have read through the reviews I notice you thank people for their positive reviews but not so much the negative. So I don't expect anything back because I'm sure you won't respond. Word of mouth is strong. I will continue to tell people U DON'T GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR WHEN YOU BUY TICKETS TO THE NEW YEARS EVENT. Pictures from what lead me to purchase the event tickets here. So much false advertisement with this establishment and they give a pathetic I'm sorry you feel this way in response to negative reviews. Do not do anything about it. They requested I email and I did and after 4 days still NO RESPONSE! Poor customer service for a poor establishment!
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We went to Copacabana for the Salsa class. The instructor was exuberant and energetic. Too bad the class ended after 20 minutes because someone fainted during the class. At 10PM the party was suppose to move upstairs but it was delayed until 11PM. Our group party moved upstairs and sat in one the areas ( NO RESERVED CARD). About one hour later, somebody tells me our area is reserved for a birthday party. Next comes the waitress and bouncer, after a few minutes we are informed unless we moved out we are going to be thrown out of the club. Fearing for an altercation we moved to another area but the gesture ruined the evening and we left. No, we did not talk to manager because we though it was going to be fruitless to talk to them.
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: not a fan. their is no seating and I have a problem with that. You only get to sit down if you pay for bottle service!! women wear heels out and our feet believe it or not hurt at the end of a long day so to have no seating is a problem, I had to sit on a stage with the DJ music blasting in my ears not a good first impression. Cant say much for anything else due to my feet hurting because i had to stand most of the night!
ReviewTitle: no seating for the heel wearing woman!
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Wonderful atmosphere. So friendly. This is a classy club with so much history. So much a part of the New York scene. You have to experience this club at least once in your life.
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I have never given a bad review until now. I would not even given a 1 star but that was the minimum. I came to this club from the Philly are for a private event of ballroom dance. Tickets were purchased 2 months prior. It was an extremely hot and humid day. Arrived after 6 pm and told they would not open til 7pm. We went across the street to a sports bar restaurant to have a snack and water to stay cool. At 7pm we ventured back and a line had formed outside and were still not letting anyone in. I stood in front of a pizza shop which had its oven exhaust blowing on me on top of the extreme heat outside. I started to not feel well due to the heat. Finally at 7:25 they started letting the line in. By the time I managed the second set of stairs I collapsed from the heat. If it were not for my husband to go in search of water to help revive me I do not know what would have happened. The security thugs in the place were pushing me down the steps and wanted me to go outside back into the heat which caused the problem, as opposed to letting me sit in a chair at the top of the landing and recover. A scene ensued to remove me to the outside to walk around and come back. We went back to sports bar and an angel of a hostess saw that I looked piqued and offered to give me a huge cup of ice water which made me feel so much better. I really wanted to go ballroom dancing and we came a long way. We returned and found that we could not attend the event by the security thugs. We were told to leave. I thank God nothing serious happened for they would be held responsible. What a horrible establishment. I have never been treated as poorly as their security staff did and pushing me down the steps was uncalled for.
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I went to this club and had a wonderful time. Had some drinks almost ever body was dancing mostly there were females in the club not alot of men there were dressed like when you really go to any other club dressing sexy they had good Spanish and American music very laoud could not even talk any young or party person would want to go.
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Excellent music and atmosphere for salsa music lovers, that's the place to go, the drinks were sensible priced so you don't need a fortune to have a good time. Highly recommended.
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: The copa is so much fun. It's beautiful and a nyc icon. The place is full of glitz and glamour that you expect on a night out in the greatest city in the world.
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Went out dancing expecting a Latin club, to find out this place was a youth hang out bar. My friend and I must of danced 5 songs (Latin), throughout the whole night. We were disappointed, since we had heard great reviews about this place. If your 20 years old, a great place ... if your 35 and over, not the place you want to be. Just my opinion.
ProviderLocation: 268 West 47th Street , & 8th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I've been to the Copa many times for salsa dancing. People have to understand this is a dance club. Don't expect any seating and services. Must check your coat and bag for $3.00, cannot bring your own water. There are lots of salsa dancers all different levels. You can bring your own dance partner or find one easily. The classes are very basic. Usually there are buffets early in the evening. If you get there early, the price is very reasonable (from free to $5.00 $10.00 depend on the activity). Best for group celebration. It's a great place to have fun!
ReviewTitle: Great spot for Salsa dancing, bring your dancing shoes

ReviewText: I was keen to check out this venue before we got to NYC because it looked very cool, so we popped in for a drink one night and although the bar has a great feel, the staff sort of blew it for us. We stayed for 1 drink and left.
ReviewTitle: Nice place, VERY expensive drinks & the staff came across a little arrogant.
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: As a hotel resident we often visit the cellar bar. The atmosphere is great and we get well looked after by the staff. Drinks are priced as you would expect for this prime location.
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: A unique dark and sexy bar (would you expect any less from the Bryant Park Hotel?) ideal for a pre or post dinner drink in Midtown. Solid drinks, immersive design and an ideal place to meet up before dinner or late night plans. The energy increases into the night, so if you're looking for more of a party, head out later in the evening.
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: It is dark enough that you would need to use the candles on the bar or tables to read the very short menu. One of those trendy NY bars with $16 for a glass of wine and not particularly comfortable seating. But a strong redeeming quality is that it is relatively empty in what is a fairly busy neighborhood so if you want a somewhat quiet drink in dark surroundings, by all means go for it.
ReviewTitle: Cellar Bar at Bryant Park Hotel
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Went here after dinner at the Bryant Park Grill. We had some great martinis and enjoyed the place it is very unique and has a wine cellar feel.
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We had an awful experience at the Cellar Bar at the hotel. The bartender was paid $350 in cash for drinks for our group and when we sat back down and the drinks never came we went back up to see what happened- the bartender said we never paid! The 'manager' on duty said she would 'handle it' but moments later the bartender disappears and never returns. The manager leads me and my friend into the stairwell, now with two security guards, and claims theres no way to tell what happened and honestly finishes with "what are you going to do about it?"?!?!?!?! I've never been in a bullying situation but I honestly never want to be again. We left immediately, all of us, it was so crazy. BUT they weren't done! When I looked at my account this morning they had added more money onto one of my already paid bills! This place has quite the scam going and in a way that nasty manager was right- what can you do about it? Basically, I would stay away from the Bryant Park Hotel- New York is too great a place to be wasted spending it with these thugs.
ReviewTitle: They stole my money and claimed it never happened!
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We were staying at the Bryant Park Hotel and decided to visit the Cellar Bar prior to going to dinner. We were the first to enter as it opened, got up to the bar and was immediately greeted by Jamie (our bartender). Jamie rocked!!! Made us feel right at home and was very attentive to not just us but all of his customers. HE made the bar special for us and just could not have been a more fantastic guy! Fun place!
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: The Cellar Bar at the Bryant Park Hotel is the classiest of places with style, ambiance and great service. Located just below the hotel, this spot has great music and mixologists Tashi, Jaime and Christian know how to serve up some tasty drinks. Love the place.
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: $27 for 2 drinks? Actually 1 shot and 1 drink.... DJ wasn't that great, but the crowd made up for everything else.
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: The Cellar Bar in the Hotel Bryant Park is a very nice and appealing space for getting together with friends or co-workers after work or late in the evening. Very spacious and extremely dark with great dance music. Fantastic ambiance late in the evening after 11pm with 2 beautiful female dancers above the bar. My only issue was the prices of the drinks. Happy hour is much easier on the wallet, but it does not have the same feeling as the night time crowd. A great time can be had whenever you choose to go, but keep in mind that prices jump in the evening if you like to throw back some cocktails as much as I do. Cheers!
ReviewTitle: Great space but thick wallet needed!
ProviderLocation: 40 W. 40th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: I was keen to check out this venue before we got to NYC because it looked very cool, so we popped in for a drink one night and although the bar has a great feel, the staff sort of blew it for us. We stayed for 1 drink and left.

ReviewText: My teen daughter was finishing up two weeks of dance classes and was very sore. I looked up several highly-rated massage therapists and Rob was very easy to work with and super accommodating (especially considering this was the 4th of July holiday weekend). She absolutely loved her massage - Rob worked wonders on fixing her soreness and she felt so invigorated afterwards. I was quite amazed what just one hour session could do – we definitely will be back. He definitely knows his stuff, and I wish we lived closer so we could go more often. If you're considering CityTouch, just go - you won't regret it! I'm writing this review way late (we went last July 2015) as it had slipped my mind that I'd failed to write one. Hopefully better late than never, and should help others when deciding where to go for a great massage in New York city.
ReviewTitle: Amazing massage, tops in the city!
ProviderLocation: 242 West 27th Street, Suite 4B , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: I'm from out of town and a friend recommended Rob for massage. I got in at the time I wanted and had a very relaxing and extremely helpful massage. I hope to see him again the next time I'm in NYC!
ProviderLocation: 242 West 27th Street, Suite 4B , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Rob is absolutely first-rate - he asked all the right questions to find out what I most needed and found all the spots that were tight as well as some I didn't know about, plus provided some exercises to use going forward. After two weeks of suffering I felt much better
ReviewTitle: One of the best massages I've ever had - and the most therapeutically valuable
ProviderLocation: 242 West 27th Street, Suite 4B , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: I went for neck stiffness/pain. Excellent work. Worth the extra money versus one of the corner places. I used their online appointment calendar and it worked without a hitch. Will go again.
ProviderLocation: 242 West 27th Street, Suite 4B , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: One of the best massages in the city! Rob is a true professional, responsive and attentive to your body's needs and leaves you feeling so much more relaxed and less stressed. Plus he's very friendly and easy to talk to and his studio is spacious and very well appointed. Can't recommend him enough.
ReviewTitle: One of the best massages in the city.
ProviderLocation: 242 West 27th Street, Suite 4B , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: I read over 30 reviews online. Everything was perfect. Rob is an excellent professional. Everything is organized. Booking online is great. He pays attention to detail. The facilities are very clean and hygienic. He is a great talent. I will recommend him with the highest scores.
ProviderLocation: 242 West 27th Street, Suite 4B , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: I have been getting massages from Rob for a few years now, and was happy for him when he opened his own practice. Rob has a terrific energy about him, and I have always found his massages to be both highly effective and very relaxing. I lift weights and have an active lifestyle, and Rob's massages are an excellent counterbalance to that. He always asks what I what like to focus on, so each massage is tailored to whatever is going on with my body that day. The CityTouch space is very quiet and relaxing, and the essential oils and reflexology that Rob employs enhances that experience. The online booking process is very convenient. I look forward to my sessions at CityTouch.
ProviderLocation: 242 West 27th Street, Suite 4B , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Attended the Music of David Bowie memorial concert at Radio City Musi Hall. A wonderful venue. Had the good fortune to be seated in the Pit so only two more rows of seats between me and the stage. Although there 6,000 people behind me it was like being in a small club. Wonderful experience
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: We saw the Christmas Spectacular and spectacular it is. We also booked at back stage tour which was absolutely amazing and worth the time. We learned a ton about the history.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: cool to see a show here, smaller theater than I anticipated but lives up to its iconic image and repuation
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: A fantastic tour , well worth the money . Got to go on stage looking out to where the ordinance would be . The guide gave us lots of information about the present & the past , & we even got to meet a rocket to ask questions & chance to have a photo taken . An amazing tour for all ages , A fantastic experience THANK YOU RADIO CITY
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: This is one of the places no one should miss, but you have to plan in advance because sometimes they have shows you wont like or get sold out early. The whole theatre and its accoustics are just grand, but the dancers named rockettes I would say are the main attraction. If you do no care about the show, I think you also have the option to take a tour of the place, but it is not the same.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: The tour was excellent and the Staff were so friendly and welcoming. I would definitely recommend a visit.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: We took the tour and it was fantastic. We were lucky enough to get to be on stage, see Roxy's room and meet a Rockette. My music loving 10 year old loved every single minute!
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: If you're in New York fit this tour into your itinery. It was fantastic and if you get Joyce as your guide you're in for a treat. She was brilliant. It was so interesting and getting to see backstage and even standing on the stage was all part of the experience. Getting to meet one of the Rockettes and then having a photo taken with here just finished off a great tour.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: I would recommend seeing their Christmas Show, it is incredible! The site is set up where there are no bad seats although my motto is if your going to spend the money, time and effort then you should get the best possible seats for your budget!
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: Every time I go to radio city music hall I am pleased with my experience. I saw the rockettes perform at least 3 times. I recently went to see the impractical Jokers on tour here and was not disappointed. I wish we were closer to them though but those tickets were too expensive. This place is huge inside and I love it.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: Attended the Music of David Bowie memorial concert at Radio City Musi Hall. A wonderful venue. Had the good fortune to be seated in the Pit so only two more rows of seats between me and the stage. Although there 6,000 people behind me it was like being in a small club. Wonderful experience
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: We saw the Christmas Spectacular and spectacular it is. We also booked at back stage tour which was absolutely amazing and worth the time. We learned a ton about the history.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: cool to see a show here, smaller theater than I anticipated but lives up to its iconic image and repuation
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: A fantastic tour , well worth the money . Got to go on stage looking out to where the ordinance would be . The guide gave us lots of information about the present & the past , & we even got to meet a rocket to ask questions & chance to have a photo taken . An amazing tour for all ages , A fantastic experience THANK YOU RADIO CITY
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: This is one of the places no one should miss, but you have to plan in advance because sometimes they have shows you wont like or get sold out early. The whole theatre and its accoustics are just grand, but the dancers named rockettes I would say are the main attraction. If you do no care about the show, I think you also have the option to take a tour of the place, but it is not the same.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: The tour was excellent and the Staff were so friendly and welcoming. I would definitely recommend a visit.
ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ProviderLocation: 1260 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) , Between 50th and 51st Streets , New York City , NY 10020

ReviewText: Wonderful, spectacular, jaw-dropping. All the Rockettes are amazing, and the scenes are classical. it was a sweet memory, and maybe a start of a tradition.
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Let's be honest every year we see the Rockettes kick off the Macy's day parade. And we wonder who really goes to these shows. Well my wife and I went on a whim while we were in NYC for the weekend during the Christmas season. We enjoyed it immensely. Granted my wife loves Christmas almost as much as her husband (ok she loves Christmas more than her husband but whatever) but still the pageantry, the songs and the sets really made you feel like a kid again. Definitely worth the trip and the time to go see it. You will not be disappointed
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: This was truly a CHRISTmas spectacular. My lady and I thought that this would have been too childish to see but we were in the area and many folks kept bragging about it so we tried it and and I cannot be happier with the results. The lines seems to go by fast so do not get scared when they are around the block. The bathrooms are easily accessible. Security is very tight. The venue itself is very classy all around. The souvenir shop is reasonably priced. The show starts off kind of slow but then you get an experience that only Radio City can bring to your eyes and ears. The Rockettes were on point and so elegant in their craft. I do not want to spoil it but it has a beautiful ending and message. Thumbs and toes way up! Definitely will bring my kids next time. Overall, great value and comfortable seating for the price. Many great things to look at before the show and worth the 1 plus hour show.
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: This is a must see show! It's beyond amazing. There is not one thing that I didn't enjoy, the whole show is beautiful. The tickets are a little on the pricy side depending on where you sit. We sat on the third mezzanine and the tickets were only 10$ plus $15 Ticketmaster fee but the seats were perfect. I was a little worried that they might be too high or too far but they were very good seats, you get to see everyone and everything! The Rockettes are just incredible. I absolutely loved this show!!
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: The Rockettes never disappoint and are a great family tradition. The dancers have the moves perfected and the atmosphere at Radio City is fantastic. While prices aren't cheap, they are worth it.
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: This was a great day in NY for my 14 year old daughter that loves all things dance. The Rockettes that taught my daughter's class were so lovely, friendly and kind to all of the girls. My daughter was so excited to learn parts from the actual dances the Rockettes are still performing today. The backstage tour was fun and I think her favourite part was learning to high kick. It gave her a new respect for how flawless they make it look on the stage! The show was so fun to see and they are so impressive with their technique and presentation. A great way to get ready for Christmas! I only gave it four stars because it was a disorganized mess from buying the tickets for the "Experience" to finding where and when we were supposed to be there on the day of the event. We did not get emailed info prior to arriving and no one at the actual theatre told us the same answer-ever! Very frustrating as they do these experiences every day during the last few weeks of Dec.
ReviewTitle: A dream experience for my daughter
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We have been to NYC several times during the holidays, but this last time was our first time to go see the Rockette's. It is a must see during the holidays to get you in the spirit. Very well done.
ReviewTitle: A Must Visit During the Holiday Season
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: A very impressive experience you must see. Is very popular in NY and all over the world is recognized.
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: I went to the Christmas Rockette show in December and wow, was I amazed! Not only was the dancing fabulous but the set, the additives and lighting was perfection. Their set changes moved with ease. I found that this show involved the audience too. I went with my friend, we are both in our 20s and I would say this show is appropriate for all ages, even kids! This show got me excited for Christmas and got me into the spirit. I loved it so much that I bought a ornament they sold in the lobby. I will definitely return for another show when I'm in New York again.
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: I don't know what took me so long to go see The Rockettes!! I loved it!! We saw the Christmas Spectacular...and we can't wait to see them again in another show!
ProviderLocation: 1260 Avenue of the Americas , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Music was good but some of the singers were very weak (or drowned out by the orchestra). Paid premium prices so had good seats and a good view. Had never seen this show before so did not know what to expect but it is a more 'lower budget' show compared to ones like Lion King etc, there is only once scene and the orchestra sit on the stage. Saying that, the show still charges premium prices that you would pay for the higher shows. We booked up specially to see a Broadway show whilst visiting New York and glad we also booked up another one as this would have been a disappointing visit otherwise
ReviewTitle: Glad to have said I've seen it but would not bother again
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: I've seen Chicago before and was impressed, this time not so much. It was fine, not great, not excellent.
ReviewTitle: Fun but not what it used to be
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: Really enjoyed the show, after purchasing the tickets online through the Today Tix app. Met the representative outside the theatre as promised to collect our tickets. The theatre is small and the seats are even smaller. Not much leg room at all. The snacks for sale, require you to remortgage your house should you want any (M&M's, Skittles and a water, $15????????). This aside, the show was very good indeed. With the theatre being nice and compact, every seat in the theatre has a great view of the stage. Thoroughly enjoyed.
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: To begin with when I was taken inside the theatre, I was rather taken aback at the seemingly old fashioned aspect. Certainly not the place to see a long running show. That's where the details fade and the magic of the show takes over. The cast were magnificent, and there-enactment of the era was superb. I was enthralled by the whole magical experience, the cast interacted with the audience and even the conductor joined in with raising the audience to enact. All in all, I enjoyed the show and was sorry when the lights went up at the end.
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: Really disappointed.. Have seen many shows before but this was my first on Broadway so I assumed it would be epic..wrong!! it was probably the worst production I've seen to date. The orchestra took up 80% of the stage leaving no room of decent choreography. Just chairs and singing. I think I could have got 6 friends together and done it in my house..
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: I was disappointed at the lack of enthusiasm from the opening scene for most of the show. The main two leads and the one understudy were the only people who tried. Sometimes there were only 2 dancers while the other several were just moving. This was an off, off-Broadway performance at a Broadway price. We all wish we saw something else instead.
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: I got tickets to invite a cousin who was visiting NY and honestly I think it was a complete waste of money! I have been to multiple Broadway shows and this one was so bad that I was falling sleep during the show. The acts I will say was barely ok, I even saw a better show on a cruise last year! There is no change of costumes, scenery, its just a giant stair in the middle of the stage with the orchestra in there but there is no movement at all. At the beginning I thought well this is new but maybe the dancing will be spectacular but it wasn't either. I don't think it really connected with the audience and in all Broadway shows even the OK ones are people who stand up at the end, didn't see anyone in this one. My advice is if you are visiting the City just choose another show, this one is just not worth it!
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: Playing in the 95 year old Ambassador Theatre, Chicargo whips the audience up into a whooping, clap a long frenzy. Powerful singing, interesting set design, fab orchestra, and a hilarious water boy selling 10oz cups of wine and $5 bottles of water (tip: they're $1 outside). Seats are small and narrow since its an old theatre but it all adds to the atmosphere.
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: First of all, the venue was not good. The ambassador theatre - way too small. Seats were also too tight. The theatre just felt dirty. Our seats were 5th row (that was good) but far left (which meant we couldn't see 1/4 of the stage. That was frustrating). Next, the show. Some actors were good. Some were average. With all due respect, it looked and felt like many of the actors may have been 3rd rate actors. I felt bad for the few that were good and putting a lot into their performances. The costumes were fair and they wore the same ones through entire performance. The band was good but took up 75% of the stage - odd and annoying. During the performance, the male dancers sat on the stage, to the side. Some looked like they were focused on the performance at hand while others had arms crossed and yawning. Chicago is a great show....but this was particular one was just ok.
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: This was my first visit to a show of any kind. I had wanted to go to a show while visiting New York as had heard good stuff about Broadway. Went to TKTS on Sunday to a long cue which didn't take long to sieve down. When at front I had originally wanted to go see Les miserables but the fact it was well over 90$ per ticket which included a discount I had asked for a cheaper option, the server recommended Chicago at 56$ and am I glad that she did!!! The show was amazing and the white experience was top notch. The performers were on point and the place was buzzing. "All that jazz" right enough !!
ProviderLocation: Ambassador Theatre , 219 W. 49th Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: When I googled this place, the address showed up as 550 Madison Ave. We took a taxi to 550 Madison Ave and walk in and were told by a person working at that location that it moved to 25 Madison which was on the other side of town so we wasted the fare of the cab ride there and subway fares back uptown. When we got to 25 Madison and googled it again it had permanently closed on the Google site. My kids were heartbroken! Thanks a lot Sony!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Sony Wonder Technology Lab is really great for kids 8-12. Parents won't be bored by this kid's activity. It takes under two hours and is a very nice break for kids between sightseeing activities. Some of the activities were too difficult for my youngest, but he had fun with what he could do. For parents with special needs children, your child may not be able to do everything, but they can have fun. If one area has too much stimulation, you can move along quickly, if one area is great for them, you can stay as long as you like. If you get tickets ahead of time, you avoid what can be a long wait. Be sure of your plans. If you are late you will not be admitted and will need to get another ticket for a later time.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Lots of technological gadgets. Fun store. Starbucks is next door. I can hang in there all day long I highly recommend.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: We went with the family to see the Sony Wonder Technology Lab during a family vacation shortly after Christmas. We called and reserved ahead, so there was no line to worry about or anything. Sony seems to have put a lot of effort into this place, but sadly it feels like since technology is changing so fast it is difficult for them to keep the wow factor. Highlights for us were the motion sensor cameras in which you are able to see your actions transferred onto a cartoon character. The television studio setup was also pretty cool to see. Unfortunately it seemed like several of the exhibits were not functioning to their fullest capacity, and for a lot of the children ran around spending 30 seconds to a minute at each station before finally plugging themselves in front of the Playstations on the bottom floor. I suppose "Underwhelming" describe the experience well.
ReviewTitle: It's Free, But Nothing Super Groundbreaking or Exciting Here. See a Movie Instead
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: We enjoyed our visit to the Sony Wonder Technology Lab. There was something for all ages, from video games to interactive exhibits to making your own TV news program. And, to top it off, it's free. Unfortunately, the Lab is closing down at the end of this month. If you're interested, go soon!
ReviewTitle: Cool, free technology exhibit -- but hurry!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Effective January 29, the Wonder Lab will be closed. Our kids had a lot of fun, particularly with the camera animatronics (we laughed a lot) and, obviously with the video games. Hard to pry the controls off their hands! Thankfully entrance is limited. Don't miss the last few weeks if you have kids in NYC.
ReviewTitle: Fun for the kids, free in NYC. Shame it's closing
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: We visited the SWTL on a tip from a co-worker who took her kids a few years ago. I called ahead to reserve tickets since we were visiting right after New Years and on a Saturday. The staff there was great, the "tickets" allow only a dozen or so people through at a time so that there's less of a crowd. The kids (7 and 10) enjoyed the interactive exhibits, especially the movie-making! I had read several not-so-favorable reviews on TA but I have to say we were pleasantly surprised by the cool exhibits and very friendly staff. Everything seemed really clean and well-maintained. If it wasn't for a few closed exhibits I'd have given it a 5-star rating.
ReviewTitle: Fun and FREE morning the whole family in the city!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Per their website, Sony's US headquarters is moving and they will be closing the Wonder Technology Lab at the end of January 2016. Get on over for one last look!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: It's free and very cool. Lots of video games, robots, and you can be a reporter for a fake television show.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Sony Wonder Technology Lab is a free, interactive and educational alternative to the holiday happenings around midtown. With three girls, ages 6-8, we entered with a timed ticket, reserved two weeks prior. This is essential! The wait at 2:00 for a walk-up ticket was over two hours. Four floors of mostly quiet (compared to outside, at least) dark, well-spaced out exhibits. Make a movie, design a video game, program a robot and watch it move and light up-all high quality and on par with the best science museums. Did I mention completely free? And surprisingly, does not empty out into a gift shop at its exit. A 5 minute holiday movie was shown while we visited. Bathrooms are on three of four floors. I can't think of a better "quiet" activity after seeing the "tree" and the like.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: When I googled this place, the address showed up as 550 Madison Ave. We took a taxi to 550 Madison Ave and walk in and were told by a person working at that location that it moved to 25 Madison which was on the other side of town so we wasted the fare of the cab ride there and subway fares back uptown. When we got to 25 Madison and googled it again it had permanently closed on the Google site. My kids were heartbroken! Thanks a lot Sony!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Sony Wonder Technology Lab is really great for kids 8-12. Parents won't be bored by this kid's activity. It takes under two hours and is a very nice break for kids between sightseeing activities. Some of the activities were too difficult for my youngest, but he had fun with what he could do. For parents with special needs children, your child may not be able to do everything, but they can have fun. If one area has too much stimulation, you can move along quickly, if one area is great for them, you can stay as long as you like. If you get tickets ahead of time, you avoid what can be a long wait. Be sure of your plans. If you are late you will not be admitted and will need to get another ticket for a later time.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Lots of technological gadgets. Fun store. Starbucks is next door. I can hang in there all day long I highly recommend.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: We went with the family to see the Sony Wonder Technology Lab during a family vacation shortly after Christmas. We called and reserved ahead, so there was no line to worry about or anything. Sony seems to have put a lot of effort into this place, but sadly it feels like since technology is changing so fast it is difficult for them to keep the wow factor. Highlights for us were the motion sensor cameras in which you are able to see your actions transferred onto a cartoon character. The television studio setup was also pretty cool to see. Unfortunately it seemed like several of the exhibits were not functioning to their fullest capacity, and for a lot of the children ran around spending 30 seconds to a minute at each station before finally plugging themselves in front of the Playstations on the bottom floor. I suppose "Underwhelming" describe the experience well.
ReviewTitle: It's Free, But Nothing Super Groundbreaking or Exciting Here. See a Movie Instead
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: We enjoyed our visit to the Sony Wonder Technology Lab. There was something for all ages, from video games to interactive exhibits to making your own TV news program. And, to top it off, it's free. Unfortunately, the Lab is closing down at the end of this month. If you're interested, go soon!
ReviewTitle: Cool, free technology exhibit -- but hurry!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Effective January 29, the Wonder Lab will be closed. Our kids had a lot of fun, particularly with the camera animatronics (we laughed a lot) and, obviously with the video games. Hard to pry the controls off their hands! Thankfully entrance is limited. Don't miss the last few weeks if you have kids in NYC.
ReviewTitle: Fun for the kids, free in NYC. Shame it's closing
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: We visited the SWTL on a tip from a co-worker who took her kids a few years ago. I called ahead to reserve tickets since we were visiting right after New Years and on a Saturday. The staff there was great, the "tickets" allow only a dozen or so people through at a time so that there's less of a crowd. The kids (7 and 10) enjoyed the interactive exhibits, especially the movie-making! I had read several not-so-favorable reviews on TA but I have to say we were pleasantly surprised by the cool exhibits and very friendly staff. Everything seemed really clean and well-maintained. If it wasn't for a few closed exhibits I'd have given it a 5-star rating.
ReviewTitle: Fun and FREE morning the whole family in the city!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Per their website, Sony's US headquarters is moving and they will be closing the Wonder Technology Lab at the end of January 2016. Get on over for one last look!
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: It's free and very cool. Lots of video games, robots, and you can be a reporter for a fake television show.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Sony Wonder Technology Lab is a free, interactive and educational alternative to the holiday happenings around midtown. With three girls, ages 6-8, we entered with a timed ticket, reserved two weeks prior. This is essential! The wait at 2:00 for a walk-up ticket was over two hours. Four floors of mostly quiet (compared to outside, at least) dark, well-spaced out exhibits. Make a movie, design a video game, program a robot and watch it move and light up-all high quality and on par with the best science museums. Did I mention completely free? And surprisingly, does not empty out into a gift shop at its exit. A 5 minute holiday movie was shown while we visited. Bathrooms are on three of four floors. I can't think of a better "quiet" activity after seeing the "tree" and the like.
ProviderLocation: 56th Street & Madison Avenue , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: A broadway show that is fascinating from the first minute until the last one. Great performers, music, dance etc, etc The story was good and the decor was perfect and on top of it: We had good seats in this lovely theatre.
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We celebrated with going to TKTS for a discount matinee and chose this show, long awaited. Great story, wonderful costumes, fantastic singing, comedy, just all round funny enjoyable show. We had great seats too.
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Got tickets from the Square for that evening, excellent seats in a small theatre so great view of the stage. Acting superb, the lead was awesome. Really flounced!! So funny. Highly recommend it.
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We saw this with Wayne Brady in the lead role. He was tremendous! Unfortunately, it was his last performance, but the show's music and energy is strong enough that it should still be an enjoyable experience.
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Great show for everyone. Laughs, Tears, ------. Great music and sets. 2 hours flew by so fast! Theater was intimate, go see it!
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Was wondering what to expect as it wasn't our first show...it was good but it could have been better, glad we got discount tickets. Lola definitely star of the show, some of the singing by Charlie actor was boring and there should have been some known songs but we did really enjoy it
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We really enjoyed this show. Not only is it a fun and worthwhile story, the cast did a great job. We would highly recommend seeing this musical. Fun, fun, fun!
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We bought tickets from the box office last minute. I was a bit nervous that they were in the Mezzanine and only $45 a piece. The box office employee assured me that all the seats in this theater were good because it is a small venue. I trusted him and we were not disappointed! I would probably even pick mezzanine seats again for this show- and the price can't be beat. We took our 11 year olds and they loved it. Besides explaining to them about drag queens, it is very family appropriate. We felt it has a good message about not bullying and accepting people for who they are in life. The music is fun and upbeat.
ReviewTitle: Not a bad seat in the theater!
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I went alone because my husband and son went to watch basketball and I LOVED it. My only complaint....the English accents weren't very good but I expect the American's say that about our actors at times. I did live the glitz and glamour and the singing and dance routines were fun. Glad I saw it on Broadway
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Fanatically funny show that has a great story as well as music. The Al Hirschfeld Theatre is very cozy with great views whether you are next to the stage or in the balcony.
ReviewTitle: Good for those who are into musical and those who are not
ProviderLocation: 302 West 45th Street , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Highly recommended for NYC. The tour guides keep up the energy and you also get surprise street performers along the way.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Booked this on our NYPasses. You need to get there first thing to book for later in the day as its v popular. We did it in the evening. A novel idea and some good actors and artists make this a unique experience but wouldn't say it's worth the money if you are just paying separately for it.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We had a New York pass and queued for an hour and a half to get tickets (from 8am) we were about 20th in the queue and got the show we wanted to see. Only one person needs to buy the tickets providing they have the New York passes. I'd recommend doing what we did - two of you go and take it in turns to queue whilst the other explores. Carlo's bakery is very close and nice and quiet at that time, so coffee and cannoli definitely helped with the waiting, and the waiting is definitely worth it.. When you come back in the evening arrive at least 15 minutes before your time slot to get the best seats, we were there about 25 minutes before and gt the best seats on the bus! I an honestly say the Ride was the best thing we did in New York, we went on the 8.30pm one and it was just fabulous. I cried with laughter throughout. Scott was absolutely fantastic and we were fortunate enough to be sitting right near him, so enjoyed being part of it. I would not go on The Ride expecting a tour of the sights, far better a Hop on Hop off bus (or the Ride the Tour) this is a comedy show (trying not to say too much to spoil it) but you never know who is part of the act, or general public. I would highly recommend this.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We were lucky enough to experience the 'holiday' ride on 18th December. My boyfriend had just proposed to me in Central Park before boarding the bus, and we were asked if anyone was celebrating anything so we told the host of our engagement. The rapper (tiny Tim) congratulated us during one of his raps. It was an experience never to forget and I'm just upset I didn't film it! If you're in New York, go!!
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I paid the princely sum of 135 pounds for myself and 2 teens to do The Ride on our "once in a lifetime" trip to NYC. Unfortunately, and through no fault of our own, we missed the bus by an hour. We went to the booking office in the hope of rescheduling but were told and emphatic and curt NO! Whilst I understand our missing the bus was our responsibility a little flexibility would have been appreciated. As a result, I have lost 135 pounds - a painful experience. So, if you book this attraction, then take care not to miss the bus!!!
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: This was OK, and children would probably like it, but it is loud, silly and you barely get to see the city.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I took my niece to NYC for her 10th birthday and this was part of it. I told them it was her birthday and they made her feel very special. There is a rapper along the route who rapped about her birthday! It was GREAT! The two tour guides on the bus were friendly and funny. It was a great experience and a lot of fun. I highly recommend!
ReviewTitle: Great fun for young and not so young!
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We got up early and took 2 subways to ge in line for The Ride Reservatinos. We arrived 30 minutes from the time their box office opened. Someone came out and informed us there were only 170 tickets for NY pass holders, and that the people in the back of the line had no chance of getting a ticket. Funny thing is, there were less than 100 people in line. Rip Off. Makes me wonder if they sold all the tickets to the general public and just save what is left over for us idiot NY Pass Holders. I do not recommend wasting an entire morning for the off-chance you might get a ticket for this.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We did the ride using the NYpass and there were many things wrong about it. Firstly, the queuing process to obtain tickets was a total joke. Using the NYpass meant limited ticketing options but how arduous and inconvenient they make it is inexcusable. We got ours on our 3rd attempt after the previous 2 times were sold out. It involved waiting in line at 8am, an hour before the box office opened to get a "pre-ticket" followed by waiting at another line to get the actual ticket. The whole process took a good 2-3hours. Sorry but this is just frankly not acceptable. I have seen ticketing process done in 3rd world countries done far more efficiently than how the Ride team does it. The ride itself was a total disappointment, a guy and girl who were unfunny, ignorant and offensive with slapstick moments to justify entertainment. I did like the rapper and breakdance guys but the rest were in poor taste and appalling. For the effort it took to get tickets, I will NOT be recommending the RIDE to anybody, even if its free with the NYpass. There are far better things you can do with your time in NYC. They really need to sort out and simplify the ticketing process asap as it was simply appalling. Go for this at your own peril
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Having been to NYC five times before, I would recommend new visitors opt for a Big Bus tour where they drop and pick you up. This tour overlapped a couple of places. The hosts were very lame. The street performers were okay.
ReviewTitle: Take a Big Bus tour as opposed to this
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ProviderLocation: New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Bryant park was a lovely little find in the middle of our day. Surrounded by fascinating buildings, it still manages to get a lot of day time sunshine. On one side is the Bryant Park hotel, a beautiful old building with incredible detail. On the other is the 'Grace' building, beautiful in a completely different, modern way. At the 'end' is the rear of the New York Public library. In between is the park - calm, serene, pretty. The surrounding streets aren't too busy with traffic, so it's not particularly noisy. There are some 'kiosk' style cafes and plenty of seats, and trees and flowerbeds line the edges. There's also a carousel, which went down very well with 10 yo DD! It's not very big, so it's no more than a passing distraction, but it's a great place to take a break in a busy, busy city.
ReviewTitle: Lovely little oasis in central Manhattan
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: I decided to visit Bryant Park on Sunday morning after reading about it. Small park among sky-crappers. It was dry as month was March. Chilled morning. Couldn't find worth coming again.
ReviewTitle: Nice park in between big buildings
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: We had fun shopping in the little shops Bought puppets too! There was food to buy. The kids liked ice skating the best.
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: As my first trip to New York I stayed at a hotel close to Bryant park. The trees, the flowers, and the seating reminded me of my trip to Paris years ago. It was beautiful-even being very busy it still had an elegance to it. I highly recommend taking a moment to sit here in the park. There are vendors with food to eat and a restaurant covered in beautiful vines here.
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: Butted up against one of the busiest areas in The City (Times Square) this wonderful park gives a spell of relief in between jostling crowds and street corner hucksters. Some wonderful kiosk-style eating options to be enjoyed on any of the many seating areas throughout the park. I understand they also run movies outdoors here in the summer. Great idea.
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: For me no trip to NYC would be complete without this place. It is a little bit of tranquility hidden in the concrete jungle. It's a lovely place to sit and chill, people watch or catch up with friends. It has Wi-Fi if you need to catch up with the rest of the world, but otherwise sit back and enjoy this place.
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: Fantastic small park amongst all these huge buildings. Is for all ages, children's play area, tables and chairs to play games. Adult area to play chess, and various games. A lovely bar for a nice glass of wine.......what more do you want
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: A small park by comparison to Central but rather quaint. They have seating areas for you to watch people passing by and a cafe. It is set at the back of the public library and is worth the visit.
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: i love this place with its eclectic mix of old and new high buildings surrounding it .. also they have films showing in summer and its great , saw goldfinger , got a cocktail from the restaurant in the far end of the park .. happiness
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: This park changes with the seasons and never disappoints. It has become a required stop when I visit New York. Take a visit to the public library then rest up among the trees of the park or stretch out in the lawn.
ProviderLocation: between 40th and 42nd Streets & Fifth and Sixth Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: We came to New York with this on the list and I must say that I am enlightened to what the Garment district offers. It was close to our hotel and although we thought that we would shop on 34th where Macys is located, the Garment district was a true rival. My teenagers loved all of the fabric shops and the sample sales. First off, the TSA probably thought, holy cow, how could they fit that much fabric in that duffle bag! Great prices and neverending selections that you will not find in mainstream fabric stores. For the shopping part, you have to read the doors which will indicate if it a wholesale or sample store. Sample store, you are in and bring cash! Here is the skinny, if like me, you have teenages who are planning to go to the typical dances. Instead of buying dresses from a catalog or spending $$$$ on a dress, GO TO THE GARMENT district. We did not get a dress because we did not have room but I saw a gown that was in Macys for over $200 for $15. It was a steal and it all depends on which shops and style you are looking for but I am guessing that you will get a much better deal here than other places. We will come back.
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We had a great time walking the garment and fashion district. We wished we had more time to shop here. If you go, set a few hours or even the whole day and even thou almost everyone we visited take credit cards I feel you can negotiate a bit more with cash. No fitting rooms so I will suggest to go in biking shorts or leggins as some shop owner will let you try things on their storage room.
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Well, as a first time visitor to NY, I was overwhelmed by most places. Same was the case with garment district too. I was attracted by the Button on a pin sculpture which made me wander in the neighbourhood. Not a touristy place but garment exporters / businessmen might be able to extract the maximum. Worth a visit if you are nearby..

ReviewText: It's a good place if your interested in wholesale shopping or sample shopping. The one thing about sampling shopping is that you can't try things on, so it's a good deal if you know your size in the brand or your okay with altering the clothes after if it doesn't fit perfect. If your looking for a evening gown or a coat deal you've come to the right place! I got a Michael Kors wool jacket for $100. Check out 132C West 36 Street for jackets. The dresses are amazing and beautiful. Of course there is all the fabrics as well.
