ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: I and close associats from out of town recently visited the Garment District in order to find needed fabrics for upcoming events. The fabrics found in New York are fabulous and many are rare type fabrics that basicaly cannot be found anywhere else outside of Paris, France. The location was awsome, everyhting right there including Time Square, Macy's, great restaurants, hotels and other important points of interests and transporation such as the subway. Additionally, my impression of Manhattan was quite different that what I expected, considering I hadn't been there in years. The people seemed rather laid back and for the most part, very friendly and overall, I never saw any type of problem. It appears that people there basically wanted to have a good time even though it is quite active with the hustle and bustle and tourist. Yet, I enjoyed New York greatly and look forward to retun and to have a good time, eating, spending money and seeing the sights. Also, about the Garment District, we encountered a number of merchants who said they were going out of business as a result of being squeezed out in terms of extremely high rental space, which is out of the question for a number of merchants. Considering there is much history with the Garment District that is known worldwide, I hope there is a way to preserve the importance of the Garment District and support the germent merchants realizing they provide an important service for fashion designers and others who travel there seeking top quality fabrics and other merchandise and to even support their own businesses.
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Mood fabrics was absolutely my Mecca. Any sewing buff would love it although it was a bit overwhelming at first the staff was great and very helpful.
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: As a seamstress I enjoyed every second I spent in all the fabric stores! Mode was amazing 3 story ceiling to floor fabrics. Also found several smaller stores. Well worth the visit!
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We accidentally stumbled upon this area to the delight of my creative daughter .We really liked the store that sold beads, beads and more beads! . We didn't find the prices to be dirt cheap but there was a really wide variety that you wouldn't normally get elsewhere. Worth a visit if this is your thing
ReviewTitle: Great variety if you're interested in habadashery etc
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Basically, a scruffy run down neighbourhood, with a lot of highly overpriced arts/craft shops and designer outlets, which you would also find on 5th Avenue in far more pleasant surroundings! Don't bother going there!
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We came to New York with this on the list and I must say that I am enlightened to what the Garment district offers. It was close to our hotel and although we thought that we would shop on 34th where Macys is located, the Garment district was a true rival. My teenagers loved all of the fabric shops and the sample sales. First off, the TSA probably thought, holy cow, how could they fit that much fabric in that duffle bag! Great prices and neverending selections that you will not find in mainstream fabric stores. For the shopping part, you have to read the doors which will indicate if it a wholesale or sample store. Sample store, you are in and bring cash! Here is the skinny, if like me, you have teenages who are planning to go to the typical dances. Instead of buying dresses from a catalog or spending $$$$ on a dress, GO TO THE GARMENT district. We did not get a dress because we did not have room but I saw a gown that was in Macys for over $200 for $15. It was a steal and it all depends on which shops and style you are looking for but I am guessing that you will get a much better deal here than other places. We will come back.
ProviderLocation: Manhattan , New York City , NY

ReviewText: The Hispanic Society of America (building, 1908) is a smallish, free museum, located west of Broadway immediately north of 155th Street - just within Washington Heights (said street is the unofficial boundary between Harlem and Washington Heights). Here are surprisingly good works of art from bygone centuries from Spain, as well as from various Spanish-speaking countries in the Western Hemisphere, including paintings (el Greco, one Goya), religious statuary, porcelain, furniture, silver, marble, and more. ln the same compound, the Audubon Terrace Historic District, are several other interesting historic buildings: the Boricua College (originally American Geographical Society; 1911), with a majestic equestrian statue of el Cid; the former Museum of the American lndian (1922); the former American Numismatic Society (now American Academy of Arts and Letters Annex; 1907); the American Academy of Arts and Letters (1923); and the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Esperanza (1912). Wherever you go in New York City, it is highly recommended to use the architectural guidebook AIA Guide to New York City.
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: Art & craft of extraordinary skill. Unique Sorrolla mural of Spain and paintings of masters. Not to b missed.
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: A must see if you love Spanish paintings! Morales, El Greco, Velazquez, Murillo, Goya and particularly a spectacular collection of Joaquin Sorolla, the Spanish Master of the late nineteenth, early twentieth century. His series called "The regions of Spain " is breathtaking, and will never been shown outside this Museum, because of the huge size of the paintings. Also beautiful sculpture and ceramics. Definitely worth a visit! easy to get there by the Subway.
ReviewTitle: Fantastic Spanish paintings and ceramic collections, uptown
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: Like some of the other reviewers, I had never heard or visited this small gem of a museum. It is comprised of two floors with an open central area. The exhibits include ceramic plates from Spain, wooden inlaid chests from “Portuguese India”, elaborate iron door knockers from the 1500's, religious reliquaries and ancient marble stonework, paintings (including a few from El Greco, Sorolla and Goya), etc. The exterior of this early 1900's building is also to be admired as it was designed to be part of a collection of small museums. The museum is a real treasure as its small size and helpful staff ensures a rewarding visit. Other: The museum is readily accessible by public transportation (e.g., the W157th Street station on the #1 subway line). If you plan on driving, you may wish to contact the museum for recommendations concerning locations of public parking garages. There is on the street metered parking, but regrettably, no empty spaces were present when I visited. After your visit to the museum, you may wish to walk a few blocks west to Riverside Drive and enjoy a view of the George Washington Bridge.
ReviewTitle: Part Gallery, Part Library, Part Oasis
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: This place is relatively small in comparison to other museums. However, it still packs a punch with the high quality of "big time" museum pieces they seem to have on hand. The rooms are big and the art is great. Imagine, if you will, going into the Met or MOMA but instead of it being gigantic with 50 rooms, it is instead only about 7 or 8 rooms. But the rooms are still high ceiling, large, packed with great stuff. The building is a tad bit run down but that isn't really an issue. The huge, HUGE problem with this museum is the lighting is terrible. This is by far the worst lighting I've ever seen in a museum. I am not a lighting expert, so I know nothing about how that works. So if you do something so bad that a layman can see that you've done something wrong, then something is really wrong. The lights are somehow done that sometimes you literally can't see paintings even if you are straight on looking at them. Add to that problem that there is limited room to maneuver (for example, upstairs on the balcony level). It's one of those things where you look at something and the glare is so bad so you move over to a side to see it, that's the problem plaguing about 50% of the art here. Otherwise, for free it is a great way to spend 30 to 60 minutes. Highly recommended for the locals.
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: The museum was not crowded at all when we went, so we were able to take all the time we wanted perusing. I really enjoyed my time there, and the artwork and other exhibits are very well kept, well explained, and spaced to encourage taking your time. The courtyard is beautiful with the statue of El Cid, and the building itself is beautiful.
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: Not only is the building gorgeous, but the collection of art within will blow your mind! El Greco, Goya, 15th-century Moorish panels… A real treasure and a real pleasure
ReviewTitle: A secret gem in Washington Heights
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: The Hispanic Society of America is tucked away into a museum plaza/complex in upper Manhattan. You wouldn't even know it was there if you weren't looking for it. It's a research library in an elegant building and also happens to house great Spanish art. Out of the way but definitely worth a visit.
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: An amazing find in New York No queues, an art gallery that time left behind. If you love Sorolla then you must go here. Some great paintings all with that light that Sorolla gives to his work and in a place that you wold not expect. Well worth a visit.
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: The sheer number of museums and galleries in NYC are overwhelming, even to dedicated NYers. We all can miss new or out of the way venues. And there are so many do not miss museums in NY that many visitors to the city are hardpressed to scratch the surface. But, if you love great old art, and want to get away from the crowds that overwhelm MOMA and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Hispanic Society of America is a lesser know, infrequently visited, choice. Imagine, El Greco, Goya, Velazquez, hanging in near silent galleries. If you live in the NY area, or if you visit affords you the time, do visit.
ReviewTitle: World class Spanish art, no crowds!
ProviderLocation: 613 West 155th St , at Broadway , New York City , NY 10032-7501

ReviewText: In one week we saw 5 shows. I recently found out about online lotteries, and even better, rushes for plays. Many plays sell their unsold seats at a discount on the day of the show. Be at the box office when they open, or slightly before. Be sure to ask for rush tickets, or they will attempt to sell you full priced tickets. Our rush seats ranged from terrific to not bad. But the price was fantastic. Check out the Billboard site to find which plays have lotteries and which have rush tickets. Some have both. Show quality is top notch.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: Spent four days in New York and took in two Broadway musicals. If only I lived here, I would watch at least one a week. I was fortunate to see The Book Of Mormon and Fun Home, both of which are comedies. However, both deal with subjects that are not for the faint of heart. Luckily, I can handle just about anything. Regardless, Broadway in New York is simply an awesome experience whether or not you see a comedy, drama, tragedy, or just something for the kids. The main thing is you are supporting the arts!
ReviewTitle: It May Not Be Leister Square, But It Comes Close!
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: If you like busy, bustling atmosphere and people watching then this is a place for you. Lots of shows to choose from.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: The mots beautiful pari with the nature ,the light the calme in the city IT is amazone ,wonderful enjoy
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: Caught three shows in four days and all were amazing. Get tickets in midtown at TKTS for slashed prices.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: Our vacation centered on the theater district, so we spent plenty of time walking on Broadway. Around Times Square you get the height of tourist-trapping, with hawkers on every corner trying to get your attention and the array of electronic advertising. Go north from Times Square to Central Park and you get a more elegant New York with finer restaurants and the Lincoln Center. Go south from Times Square and you get interesting tourist possibilities sprinkled into the New York for people who live there as well as a much wider variety of shopping and restaurants. Walking it and being able to stop in anywhere that catches your eye is worth it, though I recommend taking the subway back north if you walk a long way south - the slope of the hill is gentle but persistent.
ReviewTitle: Walk Broadway for a cross-section of New York life
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: Everything I expected and more! The lights, people, excitement are all very real and very fun! Imagining all the people for New Years is a bit overwhelming but in an extremely fun way!
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: You are in NYC and this is some of the best theatre in the country I have seen. The cast and crews are so talented and there is real charm in these old buildings. Do your homework to determine what shows you are interested before you arrive and if they are going to be available for your visit and get an idea on what the retail prices are. The TKTS booth in Times Square has a limited number of tix for some (not all - and never Disney or wicked) which are anywhere between 30-50% off retail.i was surprised to be around people who were surprised that a 50% off price was more than their family wanted to spend. Please keep in mind that you need to get in line before the window opens if you are trying to nab a popular ticket (if the booth opens at 3, get there at 2:30). This trip we saw Fiddler on the Roof and Tuck Everlasting. Both were amazing! I would also remind you that if you see multiple shows in the same week, there is a VIP line line you can use after the first one which saves some time and you get first dibs on what is available.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: We all love to see theatre musicals live and when in New York, you can't afford to miss one. There are shows for most of the year and the challenge is which one to pick. It's only a walk away form the bustling heart of Times Square, and makes it easy for you to shuttle from one theatre to another. You can't afford to not visit Broadway atleast once and watching a musical with it.
ProviderLocation: New York City , NY

ReviewText: I have to be honest and say I wasn't sure about going to see this musical. We were undecided between Jersey Boys (which I had already seen but my boyfriend hadn't) or Matilda which neither of us had seen. We decided on Matilda and I was concerned that it would be too child like and pantomime style but I couldn't have been more wrong! It was outstanding from beginning to end! The girl who played Matilda was fantastic and the man who played miss Trunchbull was the star of the show. The English accents from the American cast was a little hard to get used to at first (especially for the character playing mum!) but the children made the show and I would definitely recommend!!
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: The show is amazing, enjoyed by both adults and children! The set, the songs, the story - wow! Most of all the cast!! What a talented bunch of actors and actresses! We caught the show with Mattea as Matilda and apparently she's the youngest and smallest Matilda. She is filled to the brim with talent!! Definitely recommended for families with young children.
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I've seen a lot of musicals and could not wait to see Matilda. I was not dissapointed. Yes they deviate from the book a little, but the songs are catchy and the talent inspiring. I'm British and the majority of accents were pretty awful, but in some ways this added to the charm. I'd highly recommend this show.
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I had been to see Lion King on my last visit to NYC. So had high expectations for Matilda. I have to say it did take me a while to get into it at first as it was not what I was expecting. As some of the other reviews say the accents weren't great and kept drifting in and out. At the beginning it was very over the top with lots of shouting and shrieking which was hard to get used to. Just before the first half ended though I really started to get into it and really went on to enjoy it. The second half was much much better. Theatre is pretty small with very little leg room!
ReviewTitle: Very good once you get into it
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Love the movie and book...and musical! So much fun! We had 180 students and was on day 6 of our trip, I stayed awake! We visit a musical annually and by the time the adults sit down we fall asleep. This year I stayed awake. It was great!! Highly recommend the show for all families.
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Matilda the musical By Amelia Do you want the absolute best musical on Broadway? Well Matilda the musical is the absolute best musical on broadway! It’s the perfect show for you and your family! I can prove it! First, I have to tell you the story is very interesting! The story is based on a book by Roald Dahl (called Matilda) and It’s about a girl who is super smart. Okay. I don’t want to spoil the story. So let’s move on. Oh and here’s a tip, you should read the book before you see the musical. (This is totally optional.) If the story is not enough to interest you, go for the music, it is outstanding! I like the message for the song “Naughty” that Matilda sings. The message is even if you're little don’t let mean selfish bossy people stop you from doing what best for yourself. Oh, and lets not forget the acting, it is superb! The actor who impressed me the most was the actor who played Matilda. She was very convincing, and her singing voice was amazing! She is an American 9 year old who plays a English 5 year old! (her brittish accent is really good.) This musical is awesome! I can’t recommend it enough! Oh, and each ticket is $100 per person but Matilda is worth every penny! So give your family and you a treat and go to Matilda the musical!!
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: Great musical extravaganza with highly gifted cast. The lead role is such a small dot but so talented and with a big voice Story is family friendly with just a few asides that most children would miss and an impressive light show at one point they could frighten someone (more likely an adult) Only complaint - 10 dollars for a soda at the intermission !?!?
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: We had 8th row orchestra tickets, a family of 4 with kids 8 and 12...all of us had read the book. The staging was amazing. And the kids were also amazing, especially Matilda--wow to be 11 and have that sort of presence, it is just unbelievable. The first song was a little difficult to understand the words, but after that it was totally fine. Our whole family was thoroughly entertained and glad this was our Broadway pick for our NYC getaway.
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: A must see..the girl in it 'Matilda' was just excellent. The whole show was so well done. Would recommend to everyone
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I am someone who has seen a LOT of theatre, most largely in London's West End and in US Tours. This actually was my first Broadway show in New York, and I have to say there is no better show. This was the sixth time I had seen the show, and I was a bit worried I would not enjoy it so much having seen it so many times. I went because my family wanted to see it and had not seen the Broadway version, just London and the US Tour. The original London version always will be the best in my opinion BUT this certainly was just as good. The London version has an advantage of having actors with a native British accent as well as an audience more in tune with the quirkiness of the show. This quirkiness is very British and very Roald Dahl. That is not to say Americans cannot enjoy it. Quite the opposite. It is the perfect dose of darkness tempered with heart. The performers are incredible talented, especially the young actresses playing Maitlda. We saw Alexandra Vlachos, and she gave one of the best performances of the title role I have seen. The actors playing Matilda's parents and Miss Trunchbull also were excellent. There are many complaints about not being able to understand the lyrics from American audiences who can not catch the fast-paced and British-accented dialogue. I would recommend looking up the lyrics online before going if this is a concern because the songs are extremely clever and just amazing. It is a shame to miss them. Go see this show if you can. You will not regret it.
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: I have to be honest and say I wasn't sure about going to see this musical. We were undecided between Jersey Boys (which I had already seen but my boyfriend hadn't) or Matilda which neither of us had seen. We decided on Matilda and I was concerned that it would be too child like and pantomime style but I couldn't have been more wrong! It was outstanding from beginning to end! The girl who played Matilda was fantastic and the man who played miss Trunchbull was the star of the show. The English accents from the American cast was a little hard to get used to at first (especially for the character playing mum!) but the children made the show and I would definitely recommend!!
ProviderLocation: 225 West 44th Street , Shubert Theatre , New York City , NY 10036

ReviewText: If you do not stop to see Washington Square on a warm summer weekend you are missing what NYC is about. I once saw Kathryn Hepburn bicycling there. Its a magnet for musicians, poets, acrobats, and park characters. It is not a huge park, but it is smack dead center in middle of Greenwich Village. Ample benches provide seating. Watch a chess game, listen to a jazz sax, or an original song on guitar, or see a squirrel interact with a marionette. Who was/is there? Woody Guthrie, Bob Dylan, Peter Paul and Mary, Robin Williams for just a few. For a taste of what is left of the Bohemian it is a must stop. Some say it is haunted as it was once a hanging ground, a potters field and Edgar Allan Poe, as well as Dylan Thomas knew it well. If you ever saw the comedy "The Freshman" with with Marlin Brando you will notice it takes place in and around Washington Square and Little Italy. When I attended NYU for a while this was my campus. So many stories I could tell.
ReviewTitle: . NYU unofficial park made famous by everybody famous.
ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Some of the greatest views to watch people and the craziness of NYC. Sit back with a coffee and enjoy it for 30 minutes.
ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: My last visit was a few months ago, but that park has been in my mind and my heart since I studied in the downtown campus of NYU right there, my dorm was across the street, and it was a good starting point to the Village when we got tired of accounting and finance. In the park you can see a mix of people like neighbors, NYU students, a bunch of kids now playing, this time I didn't see the chess tables and the seniors that used to play there, I hope those tables are still somewhere in the park. Its a nice place to go and eat something, there are eateries all around. The metro station nearby I think is the 4th St. and you can also walk to the Village a short distance, sorry to say this but the place is pricey these days.
ReviewTitle: This park has a great history of how neighbors fought for it
ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Washington Square Park is full of vibrancy and life at every hour that I have visited. Full of students and family and retirees in the day and full of excitement (but still felt safe) at night when walking back from Greenwich bars.
ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Greenwich Village, 4th St. to Waverly Pl. and Macdougal St. to University Pl. Washington Square Park, in the heart of Greenwich Village has recently undergone some major renovations and tops our list of favorite playgrounds right now. There are three different playground sections plus a giant fountain in the center of the park. The first play area is a toddler playground for little ones learning to walk, it also has baby swings. The second is for older kids, it’s a classic playground with swings, jungle gym, sand pit and slides. The third area is what’s really special, it’s called Mounds Play Area. This area consists of contoured artificial turf mounds with a pretty amazing spider-web-like ropes course above it. This area also has traditional monkey bars and other interesting climbing structures. Our daughter loves to kick off her shoes and run free in this section. During the summer we always end up in the fountain so be sure to bring a swim suit and water shoes if you visit on a warm day. There are bathrooms and street food vendors in the area.
ReviewTitle: Best Playground in NYC for kids
ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: What a park on a sunny afternoon. Loved the Washington Arch and enjoyed just sitting and chilling, people watching, eating ice cream and lollies. And soaking up some unusually warm rays on Friday afternoon in April. Just perfect.
ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: The place to be on a weekend afternoon for hanging out and people watching. There is always a performance of some sort going on -- and sometimes a couple dozen all at once. A great melting pot of New York, where you are likely to see just about anything. Watching out for drug dealers in some of the darker corners of the part at night. But generally pretty safe.
ProviderLocation: West 4th Street , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Maybe one of the cooler things we did in NYC. There's quite a bit of waiting but it's worth it. I've seen people complaining about showing up early and being seated in the back. I think it has to do with what you are wearing and slightly about how you look. If you are dressed nice and cleaned up, they'll seat you near the front. We were the very last people to show up (got on the wrong train oops) and we were still seated near the front. So consider that when you're attending. You get a great experience of being right next door to Studio 8H which was awesome for me as an SNL fan. They had the lights on so you could see in. Seth was very funny and the experience was remarkable. Totally recommend this!
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: My wife and I and our 17 year daughter were able to procure tickets through the process set up on 1iota. It wasn't too difficult to get the Seth tickets...it was a nightmare even trying for Fallon. We had a lot of fun with this. Yeah you need to be there between 4:45pm and 5:30 pm to check in for the show that starts at 6:30 pm but that wasn't any big deal. As an audience member you're encouraged to be as interactive as possible without being disruptive. In between guests and set changes, Seth came up into the audience twice and chatted with all of us which was great. He took some questions and made fun of several things and everyone got a kick out of it. His mom and dad were there which was a nice add on because it was fun to watch them and to see the interaction. Regardless of whether you go to Seth or Kelly & Mike or any daily show I think you'll enjoy being a part of the audience and watching the behind scenes. You typically cannot make ticket requests until the prior month to your visit but you need to do it as quickly as you can on 1iota when it opens up.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: When visiting NYC recently we wanted to take in one of the late night TV shows at Rockefeller Center and were able to get tickets to Late Night with Seth Myers. The ticketing process is a bit of a logistical nightmare because you have to apply a month in advance through a convoluted process at 1iota.com. The tickets are free but you don't know if you have them until a few days before the date you requested. After having tickets in hand the process is much more user-friendly. NBC does a nice job of telling you exactly what you have to do, where to go, and when to be there. Note though that you must do exactly as the instructions stipulate or you will not be admitted. Tickets cannot be transferred and security is very tight. You line up at 445 pm at the designated spot at 30 Rock and go through security and are given your tickets. No photos are allowed once you pass this spot - NONE! You are then directed to a comfortable waiting area where you will sit for approximately an hour. If you want a photo of your group an intern will take one and email it to you which you can later post on social media. When show time rolls around you are taken to Studio 8G and while waling in you can get a glimpse of Studio 8H where Saturday Night Live is staged. An intern will direct you to one of 200 seats and a warm up comedian will welcome you and let you know how the show will proceed. The 8G band is introduced then Seth Myers comes out and the show begins. It is a fast paced very funny show with famous guests from around the world and Seth Myers is one of the most intelligent and funny guys on TV. He would be a great person with whom to spend an evening. He comes across as a very personable guy who really, really, really enjoys his work. At one point in the show he will come up into the audience to take questions. Once the show is over you are escorted from the studio and will exit through the NBC store in case you want to buy a souvenir. The whole process from standing in line to the end of the show was about 3 hours. I highly recommend the experience.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: I haven't had any luck getting in to see SNL my entire adult life, but recently since my wife's retirement, we have more weekday options for trying to score tickets to see shows being taped. We had a trip planned to go to the theater and thought we'd try for tickets to a couple of TV shows. The odd things was getting options on both "Late Night" and Colbert for the same evening. We chose Seth Meyers - and we were glad we did. First, for out-of-town guest like ourselves, we were assured we could get in - unlike Colbert. We reported to "30 Rock" got in line at about 4:45, and the step by step process of checking in and finally getting into the studio took about 90 minutes. Everything about it was super-efficient. The warm up comedian went over how we were supposed to act and react throughout the taping, but we didn't even need the direction. Seeing Meyers in person at this desk was like watching an extended version of Weekend Update from SNL. The highlight of the evening was a break while they set up for that night's musical group. During that time, Seth came up into the audience and answered every question people through at him for 10-15 minutes. Very down-to-earth and just naturally funny. Plus he stood right at the end of our row almost the whole time. The tickets were not particularly hard to get, and we had a great time. We were out by 8:00 - in time for other things the rest of the evening - even after being ushered out through the NBC store. Families just need to realize that no one under 16 gets in.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: We were lucky enough to book space a month earlier online. Don't count on standby tickets to get in. We saw a show on Tuesday and tried to get standby for Wednesday but the took only about 25 people. The NBC pages were adorable and engaged everyone and they were helpful for any questions. The show itself was fun...what's not to like about Seth Meyers!
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: Free tickets to a fabulous show starring SNL alumn Seth Meyers doing what he does best; smart comedy. To top it off the fantastic 8G band featuring SNL alumn Fred Armisen. Beautiful studio in the amazing 30 Rock. A great time was had by all!
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: I signed up for seth meyer tickets online & about 2 weeks later, I got a email saying that I got 2 tickets! I went on 2/15/2016 to the 5pm showing. You have to be there by 4:15pm. Prior to that, you are able to shop at the nbc store! It was kind of expensive. $30 for a t-shirt, $15 for a little thing of candy, but it was fun seeing all the SNL souvenirs. Once you check-in, they bring you to a waiting area for approx. 30 min. During that time, someone comes out and plays a video to get you excited for the show & you play a couple games just to get everyone interactive. (They picked 3 people to play jeopardy). Shortly after we all were escorted into the studio. I was very impressed. The studio is very nice and prior to the show starting, seth came out and introduced himself & told us a little history about the studio, etc. I thought that was really cool because I went to a couple shows before in california & the host wouldn't even interact with the crowd. The show started at approx. 6pm and we were done by 7pm. It was very funny. There were 3 guests & they were on the stage for about 10 min. Each. The show went by fast. I really enjoyed it & highly recommend it! The dress code is very casual. People were wearing jeans, t-shirts, etc. No food or drink is allowed inside and they remind you several times before entering, cellphones have to be turned off. Also, everyone there was very professional & friendly! I would def. Go back to see another show!
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: The whole process was great. I got tickets weeks in advance and what a decision it turned out to be. This is a great way to experience American culture. Samuel L Jackson was the main guest, and he and seth really got on well and were hilarious. For free entertainment, it was brilliant. Seth come out before the show to introduce himself and get the crowd going. The stand up comedian was also funny. All in all, a good experience. I got there for 5.20, for a show starting a 5.30. So there isn't really any reason to arrived much before.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: My wife I visited Late Night with Seth Meyers and had a good time. The ticket process was so much more simple and less stressful than when were there a couple years ago. Basically show up when they ask you to and the interns will allow everyone to line up, show their ID and ticket confirmations to receive their actual tickets. They give you a ticket with a letter or number on it and have you wait in a nice lounge with comfortable seating. When it is time they then call you up to enter the studio by ticket letter/number. They show you to your seat while a warm up comedian interacts with the audience. Seth comes out and the show begins. During the break while they were setting up for the musical guest Seth came into the audience and answered audience questions for about 10 minutes which was kind of neat. Other than that there was not as much audience interaction and participation like there was when we attended and Jimmy Fallon was still hosting. Nonetheless, it was a good experience and I would likely do it again, depending on the guests. The guests that we saw were Bradley Cooper, Jemaine Clemente, and The Struts ( they were actually hanging out on the street smoking when we arrived at the building).
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: We were able to get tickets to see Late Night with Seth Myers. The guest was Sean P Diddy Colmes, Jaimie Etheridge, and I don't recall the musical guest, although he was great. I loved being part of the studio audience, and would love to do it again at this or any other late night show.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: Maybe one of the cooler things we did in NYC. There's quite a bit of waiting but it's worth it. I've seen people complaining about showing up early and being seated in the back. I think it has to do with what you are wearing and slightly about how you look. If you are dressed nice and cleaned up, they'll seat you near the front. We were the very last people to show up (got on the wrong train oops) and we were still seated near the front. So consider that when you're attending. You get a great experience of being right next door to Studio 8H which was awesome for me as an SNL fan. They had the lights on so you could see in. Seth was very funny and the experience was remarkable. Totally recommend this!
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: My wife and I and our 17 year daughter were able to procure tickets through the process set up on 1iota. It wasn't too difficult to get the Seth tickets...it was a nightmare even trying for Fallon. We had a lot of fun with this. Yeah you need to be there between 4:45pm and 5:30 pm to check in for the show that starts at 6:30 pm but that wasn't any big deal. As an audience member you're encouraged to be as interactive as possible without being disruptive. In between guests and set changes, Seth came up into the audience twice and chatted with all of us which was great. He took some questions and made fun of several things and everyone got a kick out of it. His mom and dad were there which was a nice add on because it was fun to watch them and to see the interaction. Regardless of whether you go to Seth or Kelly & Mike or any daily show I think you'll enjoy being a part of the audience and watching the behind scenes. You typically cannot make ticket requests until the prior month to your visit but you need to do it as quickly as you can on 1iota when it opens up.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: When visiting NYC recently we wanted to take in one of the late night TV shows at Rockefeller Center and were able to get tickets to Late Night with Seth Myers. The ticketing process is a bit of a logistical nightmare because you have to apply a month in advance through a convoluted process at 1iota.com. The tickets are free but you don't know if you have them until a few days before the date you requested. After having tickets in hand the process is much more user-friendly. NBC does a nice job of telling you exactly what you have to do, where to go, and when to be there. Note though that you must do exactly as the instructions stipulate or you will not be admitted. Tickets cannot be transferred and security is very tight. You line up at 445 pm at the designated spot at 30 Rock and go through security and are given your tickets. No photos are allowed once you pass this spot - NONE! You are then directed to a comfortable waiting area where you will sit for approximately an hour. If you want a photo of your group an intern will take one and email it to you which you can later post on social media. When show time rolls around you are taken to Studio 8G and while waling in you can get a glimpse of Studio 8H where Saturday Night Live is staged. An intern will direct you to one of 200 seats and a warm up comedian will welcome you and let you know how the show will proceed. The 8G band is introduced then Seth Myers comes out and the show begins. It is a fast paced very funny show with famous guests from around the world and Seth Myers is one of the most intelligent and funny guys on TV. He would be a great person with whom to spend an evening. He comes across as a very personable guy who really, really, really enjoys his work. At one point in the show he will come up into the audience to take questions. Once the show is over you are escorted from the studio and will exit through the NBC store in case you want to buy a souvenir. The whole process from standing in line to the end of the show was about 3 hours. I highly recommend the experience.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: I haven't had any luck getting in to see SNL my entire adult life, but recently since my wife's retirement, we have more weekday options for trying to score tickets to see shows being taped. We had a trip planned to go to the theater and thought we'd try for tickets to a couple of TV shows. The odd things was getting options on both "Late Night" and Colbert for the same evening. We chose Seth Meyers - and we were glad we did. First, for out-of-town guest like ourselves, we were assured we could get in - unlike Colbert. We reported to "30 Rock" got in line at about 4:45, and the step by step process of checking in and finally getting into the studio took about 90 minutes. Everything about it was super-efficient. The warm up comedian went over how we were supposed to act and react throughout the taping, but we didn't even need the direction. Seeing Meyers in person at this desk was like watching an extended version of Weekend Update from SNL. The highlight of the evening was a break while they set up for that night's musical group. During that time, Seth came up into the audience and answered every question people through at him for 10-15 minutes. Very down-to-earth and just naturally funny. Plus he stood right at the end of our row almost the whole time. The tickets were not particularly hard to get, and we had a great time. We were out by 8:00 - in time for other things the rest of the evening - even after being ushered out through the NBC store. Families just need to realize that no one under 16 gets in.
ProviderLocation: 30 Rockefeller Plaza , New York City , NY 10112

ReviewText: The park itself is nothing special (physically probably the least attractive if all the well-known ones), but it has a rich history, is a go-to spot Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays, and Saturdays for the best farmers market in the city (great for produce and people-watching alike), has a great number of good places to eat and shop nearby, and is centrally located.
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: This very welcome urban green space at the bottom end of Midtown is formed by the intersection of Broadway with what was originally called 4th Avenue, today north of here called Park Avenue. The area around it was once the headquarters of some of the most obnoxious far-left organizations in the country. ln addition, it has long been the domicile of a magnificent statue of war criminal mass murderer Abraham Lincoln, the destroyer of the South, white-suprmacist and anti-Semite; today, the equally unpleasant statue of Mohandas "Mahatma" Gandhi - also a notorious anti-Semite - joins it. But don't let this hamper your enjoyment of the beautiful park, in whose northern sections you can sit unbothered by the sight of these effigies. More interestingly, here is also a magnificent equestrian statue of George Washington (who was far removed from any vestiges of anti-Semitism!). ln the center of this very welcome green space in the bottom of Midtown is a great flagpole, with an important quote of Thomas Jefferson. And there are many interesting historical buildings flanking the park on all sides, as well as on Broadway immediately north of the park. lmmediately to the east, lrving Place provides a delightful walk a few blocks north to the forbidden Gramercy Park; north of the park, the street becomes Lexington Avenue. As everywhere in this extraordinary City, use the architectural guidebook AIA Guide to New York City.
ReviewTitle: lnteresting for its architecture - but ignore two of the statues!
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Great place to escape the city with a large park, playground and markets depending on the day. It also seems to be less busy than many other parks in the city.
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Too crowded for my taste .Great for a Saturday afternoon I like the flea market display and the artists that display their art as well .But too much action and crowds for my taste .If you enjoy that sort of thing then head on over to Union square got a day out in New York City …
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: 14th St. and Broadway, at Union Square Union Square is great, first of all you’re guaranteed to see something entertaining each time you visit. The playground is pretty special too. It’s located at the north end of the park and has very innovative equipment that is fairly new. The playground has a separate section for toddlers which has a swing set, climbing platform, sand and water play area. Our daughter’s favorite part is the area for older kids. In this section they have a unique dome which is very challenging to climb. My daughter never gives up and always manages to get to the top. Once you’re up there you get a great view and sense of pride for your accomplishment. It’s also really fun to slide back down. In addition they have a unique tube slide built into a rocky bank with real rocks you can use as stairs. Another one of our favorite features is the self-propelled merry-go-round. There are bathrooms and a lot of food options in the area.
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Much less busy than the other more popular times square, but also a completely different experience, it's just a very nice big public space, a nice break from the busy streets.
ReviewTitle: Less busy than the other more popular square
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Great small park in the big city. Awesome farmers market with wide selection of things: produce, food and items.Wish I had more time to browse. Great shopping in area also.
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Take the subway and when you exit, you will arrive in a calm place in the city. We went on Wednesday. They have a farmers market that day. The flowers are beautiful! We didn’t buy any, since we are staying in a hotel. There were tons of fruits and vegetables. They were all fresh. The cider smelled amazing. There are some street vendors selling art, too. It was a nice walk on a nice day. The shops in this area are quaint and fun, too. Spend some time in this neighborhood.
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: Greenmarket is amazing! Finally normal food! You can buy relatively cheap apples, hot apple cider (in winter, very tasty and warming), real pies. I'm from Europe, so food in States was usually not edible for me - to processed, fruits in stores insanely expensive. Park itself is nice, sometimes it has working wifi (only sometimes). Squirrels are friendly, birds are hungry, playground is good for kids every age. My favorite place to relax in this part of NYC.
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ReviewText: This is a nice, well-kept park. Great statue of George Washington, a dog park, park benches to sit on while enjoying the city. There is a farmers' market on Friday and Saturday with a wide array of goods to choose from. Bakers bring fresh baked goods, farmers with fresh fruit and veggies, meat, and artisan cheese. What a treat! The location is great with lots of shopping and restaurants close by. Great place for taking a time out.
ProviderLocation: 14th-17th Street , (Broadway and Park) , New York City , NY 10001

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Took the walking tour of World Trade Center and St. Paul's Chapel. Tour was great and Monica really knew her stuff. Highly recommended!
ReviewTitle: Monica is an excellent tour guide
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Our group ended up being very small but it was great that way. Annie our guide was SO friendly, sensitive and knowledgeable. It was a very cold afternoon and so she was sensitive and asked us if we would like to go someplace that was warm to hear the first 2o minutes of talking before we started to walk. We loved her sensitivity to that because we were all shaking from being cold. The entire tour took about 2.5 hrs and she spend so much time with us. She showed us so much that we didn't even knew existed around the 9-11 tribute center. She took the time to answer all of our questions and we could tell she just loved her job as guide! Thank you,Annie! Your tour was one of our highlights of our NYC trip!!
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: it was a very interesting tour. our tour guide dennis b kept us entertained the whole way through. his knowledge of the area was impressive.inspite of the cold weather we had a very good night. the bars & restaurants were first rate.i would recommend both the tour & the guide to anybody.
ReviewTitle: our tour of hells kitchen area was great.
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Thanks to Dennis our Hells Kitchen Pub crawl was the highlight of our time in New York. We had the best night which went well beyond the tour hours - we learnt lots and made new friends. We can't wait to come back to New York and have Dennis as our guide for another tour!
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: What a disappointment, firstly we booked the Edgar Allen poe tour , nobody from uncle sams turned up and we couldn't contact them. Then we booked a three hour tour of 9 11 our guide Annie did turn up and it started great " the first 10 minutes" after that she was disinterested in any questions put to her and kept dismissing what we had to say, our tour consisted of us stopping so she could have a ciggerette break and our main topic was how much she normally gets tipped, our 3 hour tour lasted about 40 minutes. So we took ourselves off to the 9 11 museum, which was fantastic. So my advice is save your money and do the tour yourself .
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Rob was very interesting and revealed some fantastic history I had not known. Would take a second tour and do it all, all over again!
ReviewTitle: Lower Manhattan, 1 WTC, Battery Park Area
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: As I was traveling alone, I took the tour to get some insight into NYC Hell's Kitchen district and enjoy drinks with fellow travelers. The tour guide Dennis B. was great! He is a real new yorker with "NYC attitude", which was perfect. In total our group was four people. During the walk Dennis B. provided detailed information about the history of area, buildings and culture. He presented past NYC news related to the Hell's Kitchen district and there was also time for small talk. During the tour we visited three bars, which were not very special, but seemed authentic, which was of course the most important thing. I would definitely do similar pub crawl again in Hell's Kitchen or some other district. I would recommend this tour especially to get factual insight about NYC, meet new people and enjoy a few drinks. If you are more into heavy drinking, partying and dancing, you should take for example the Chelsea Night Club Tour (I have do that also).
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Thanks to Annie (our amazing tour guide) we got an in detail tour of this sad but inspiring event. To be able to get an inside view from Annie made the tour much more personal too. Thankyou!
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Took the WTC walking tour yesterday with our tour guide Annie; great tour! I watched the events of 9/11 from my office on that day. Yesterday was the first time back since. Very sad to remember the tragedy and events of that day. Saw so much strength in the patriotism of America and such solidarity from around the world. The tour was very well structured and very informative.
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: My boyfriend and I just did a walking 9/11 tour, our tour guide was Annie. She was amazing. New absolutely every detail about the event and was super humorous. Well worth it! Nice work Annie
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Took the walking tour of World Trade Center and St. Paul's Chapel. Tour was great and Monica really knew her stuff. Highly recommended!
ReviewTitle: Monica is an excellent tour guide
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: Our group ended up being very small but it was great that way. Annie our guide was SO friendly, sensitive and knowledgeable. It was a very cold afternoon and so she was sensitive and asked us if we would like to go someplace that was warm to hear the first 2o minutes of talking before we started to walk. We loved her sensitivity to that because we were all shaking from being cold. The entire tour took about 2.5 hrs and she spend so much time with us. She showed us so much that we didn't even knew existed around the 9-11 tribute center. She took the time to answer all of our questions and we could tell she just loved her job as guide! Thank you,Annie! Your tour was one of our highlights of our NYC trip!!
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: it was a very interesting tour. our tour guide dennis b kept us entertained the whole way through. his knowledge of the area was impressive.inspite of the cold weather we had a very good night. the bars & restaurants were first rate.i would recommend both the tour & the guide to anybody.
ReviewTitle: our tour of hells kitchen area was great.
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Thanks to Dennis our Hells Kitchen Pub crawl was the highlight of our time in New York. We had the best night which went well beyond the tour hours - we learnt lots and made new friends. We can't wait to come back to New York and have Dennis as our guide for another tour!
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: What a disappointment, firstly we booked the Edgar Allen poe tour , nobody from uncle sams turned up and we couldn't contact them. Then we booked a three hour tour of 9 11 our guide Annie did turn up and it started great " the first 10 minutes" after that she was disinterested in any questions put to her and kept dismissing what we had to say, our tour consisted of us stopping so she could have a ciggerette break and our main topic was how much she normally gets tipped, our 3 hour tour lasted about 40 minutes. So we took ourselves off to the 9 11 museum, which was fantastic. So my advice is save your money and do the tour yourself .
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Rob was very interesting and revealed some fantastic history I had not known. Would take a second tour and do it all, all over again!
ReviewTitle: Lower Manhattan, 1 WTC, Battery Park Area
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: As I was traveling alone, I took the tour to get some insight into NYC Hell's Kitchen district and enjoy drinks with fellow travelers. The tour guide Dennis B. was great! He is a real new yorker with "NYC attitude", which was perfect. In total our group was four people. During the walk Dennis B. provided detailed information about the history of area, buildings and culture. He presented past NYC news related to the Hell's Kitchen district and there was also time for small talk. During the tour we visited three bars, which were not very special, but seemed authentic, which was of course the most important thing. I would definitely do similar pub crawl again in Hell's Kitchen or some other district. I would recommend this tour especially to get factual insight about NYC, meet new people and enjoy a few drinks. If you are more into heavy drinking, partying and dancing, you should take for example the Chelsea Night Club Tour (I have do that also).
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Thanks to Annie (our amazing tour guide) we got an in detail tour of this sad but inspiring event. To be able to get an inside view from Annie made the tour much more personal too. Thankyou!
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: Took the WTC walking tour yesterday with our tour guide Annie; great tour! I watched the events of 9/11 from my office on that day. Yesterday was the first time back since. Very sad to remember the tragedy and events of that day. Saw so much strength in the patriotism of America and such solidarity from around the world. The tour was very well structured and very informative.
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ProviderName: Uncle Sam's New York Walking Tours
ReviewText: My boyfriend and I just did a walking 9/11 tour, our tour guide was Annie. She was amazing. New absolutely every detail about the event and was super humorous. Well worth it! Nice work Annie
ProviderLocation: 501 5th Ave , New York City , NY 10017

ReviewText: I've always been afraid to take dance lessons since I've always felt like a klutz on the dance floor but my son told me about Dance Fever Studios because he began wedding choreography lessons there and is very impressed with the owner Fran(who also instructs). Well I decided to get up the nerve to attend their Saturday Night Dance Party and it was a lot of fun. I signed up for lessons and have really boosted my confidence. The woman who is teaching me now really puts me at ease and I look forward to every session. Just a great time and glad I took the leap.
ProviderLocation: 159 20th St , Brooklyn , NY 11232

ReviewText: My wife and I were visiting our relatives in Brooklyn. They took us to Dance Fever Studios to do the Argentine tango. We were complete beginners, but loved it. This studio is a wonderful place. Highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for something different to do when visiting Brooklyn. This also have salsa and ballroom dancing.
ProviderLocation: 159 20th St , Brooklyn , NY 11232

ReviewText: Salsa lessons, tango lessons, Latin and ballroom... Dance Fever Studios has it all. I started with salsa at their Ave J studio location, now I am also taking Argentine tango at their Park Slope studio. I love both places. The teachers are great and the spaces are always filled with great people and great music. This is the best dance school I have been to yet.
ProviderLocation: 159 20th St , Brooklyn , NY 11232

ReviewText: I had been taking lessons for a long time, and this had been the best salsa and bachata lessons I had gotten. I loved how the teachers broke everything down. I loved how enjoyable the classes were and how the teachers keep the students dancing. The classes are so informative, and I left feeling satisfied and that I actually learned something. I had such a great time!! It's a great looking studio, everyone is warm and friendly. I can't wait to visit again!!!
ProviderLocation: 159 20th St , Brooklyn , NY 11232

ReviewText: Dance Fever Studios taught me how to do the Argentine tango. Come to visit Brooklyn a few times a year, and every time we go we take a tango lesson here. Francis, our teacher, is great. Really knows how to break things down. We don't get this in Atlanta. The space is also amazing.
ReviewTitle: Taught me how to Argentine tango
ProviderLocation: 159 20th St , Brooklyn , NY 11232

ReviewText: Best salsa lessons in Brooklyn. My girlfriend dragged me here, but now I love it. We tried a few other salsa schools, but the lessons were too fast and confusing. Here they really know how to break it down so even a non dancer can get it. We are regulars now.
ProviderLocation: 159 20th St , Brooklyn , NY 11232

ReviewText: You won't find a better place to learn how to dance. The teachers are all friendly and know how to teach. They are also great dancers. They have lots of different classes. If you get tired of salsa, you can do tango. Both of their studios are great.
ProviderLocation: 159 20th St , Brooklyn , NY 11232

ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: If you have a nice clear day, spend it here and in Brooklyn Heights. Beautiful view of lower Manhattan, nicely appointed along the river. We stayed nearby, walked the bridge, had brunch in the area. Great day!
ReviewTitle: Beautiful neighborhood, views, a must see
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: Visited this place after dark and the view of New York skyline was awesome. Couldnt find any eating options.
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: I had the pleasure if sitting here while waiting on my ferry. It was a nice place to view Manhattan, the helipad, people and of course pigeons. It was a nice day out, a little windy, but still a nice day to sit on the park.
ReviewTitle: A great place to sit and watch the boats or birds
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: If you visit no other park in NYC this is a must see, especially on a sunday in the summer when the food trucks are there and when the free ferry runs to Governor's Island
ReviewTitle: An Oasis in the middle of everything
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: The 1.6-acre playground at Pier 6, which is part of Brooklyn Bridge Park, could easily rival our number one spot for Best Playground in NYC if only it were a little closer to our apartment. This playground was designed by architects who teamed with childhood development experts and together they produced quite a masterpiece. The grounds include four different areas: Swing Valley, Slide Mountain, Sandbox Village and Water Lab. Each section is secluded in it’s own enclave surrounded by landscaping making it feel like there’s a new discovery at every turn. Kids are in for a real adventure as they explore each area. Our favorite activity is the rope swings in Swing Valley (which were not working our last visit but hopefully will be repaired soon). We’re also huge fans of the 20-foot-tall Slide Mountain jungle gym. Their 6,000-square-foot sandbox is also impressive. During the summer they also have a pop up pool, cafe, volleyball and other fun summer activities. We’ve never played in their Water lab but it looks fantastic. This playground is visually my favorite one to visit. There are bathrooms and a cafe in the area.
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: It provided great views of both the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges, at the same time. It was still undergoing some restorations.
ReviewTitle: Very nice diversion between DUMBO and a walk across the bridge
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: Brooklyn Bridge Park is an 85 acres ‘ Waterfront Park’ developed along the East River on the Brooklyn side, mostly around Pier-1~Pier-5 with a magnificent view of lower Manhattan just in front of you and also includes;FultonFerry Landing,Empire Fulton Ferry and Main Street Parks. Brooklyn Bridge Park Corporation are the authorities for this park with their mission to provide “world class recreational, environmental and cultural destination” to its residents, and they have succeeded in providing a wonderful place to New Yorkers. Since i am more familiar with Pier area and since each Pier area developed has its own uniqueness, beauty and charm, I need to be fare enough to write a few lines,separately on each Pier area and off course, i have written a few lines on other areas too. Pier -1: This area has three large landscaped lawns, playground for children, granite view stand/steps and also has developed and maintained gardens with native plant life and freshwater plants. One can sit in the lawns or on the granite view stand/steps for hours with friends & families or simply sit in front of the water front,viewing the Lower Manhattan skyline and watch a variety of moving boats. Pier-1 lawns are the place where various events are organised throughout the year; dance parties, movies on the open screen, workouts and even various science festivals are held. Pier - 2: This is more of a recreation area,five acres of land is developed with basketball courts, handball courts, fitness equipments and even tables for picnickers. The area provides all essentials like: restrooms,water fountains and bike racks. Pier-2 also offers a fantastic view of lower Manhattan and New York Harbour. Pier - 3: This area is known for its Greenway granite terrace with granite blocks and the unusually designed,sloping hills running all along the Pier-3 ( As per the records the hills are designed in such a way that it dilutes the intensity of sound (from nearby Brooklyn/ Queens expressway),resulting in reduction in noise pollution. Pier-3 also has two beautifully landscaped lawns and even have library. One can get awesome view of New York Harbour, besides the Governors Island and Statue of Liberty. Pier - 4: This is one place along the piers forming the part of Brooklyn Bridge Park development, where one can get a feel of the beach with sand and can literally reach the edge of the water. The area is designed with special emphasis to preserve and maintain coastal habitat of plants and marine life, with natural tidal pool. There is a bird island, part of the nature preserve,but the entry to this area is restricted. Pier - 5: Consist of a well developed fields for football (soccer) and rugby with facility with spectator viewing stands/benches lined up on the sides. There is a large area dedicated for Picnickers, where many tables with umbrellas and grills are provided to enable one to cook their own meals. Pier-5 also offers a good view of the Manhattan, Governors Island and New York Harbor. Pier - 6: This place brings one to a natural environment with variety of trees,native plants,meadows and lawns. Amenities here are spread around with; Sand Volleyball Courts, dog run facility and a speciality playground for the children/grownups, which comprises of; one of the largest Sandbox Village,Water-jet Field, Slide Mountain, Marsh Garden with a natural environment and a Swing Valley and the place is well patronised by the children /parents. Pier-6 also accommodates the ferry services to ‘Governors Island’ and a famous restaurant. There is a beautiful Greenway route for biking,offering awesome views from Pier-1 to Pier-5, and for biking,one can bring their own bike or rent it out from cite bike stations available at the designated places. Empire Fulton Ferry : Located in between Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan Bridge with its beautiful Lawns offers a great view of New York Harbor and Manhattan.One of the main attraction here is the beautiful Jane’s antique Carousel built in 1922, restored for the benefit of children and grownup, housed in a specially designed glass pavilion and offers one of the most beautiful ride in an antique carousel and is a great attraction for all age groups and charges a fee. Fulton Ferry Landing Pier: Located at the Fulton Street is the oldest location of the ferry service started between Brooklyn ~ Manhattan in the year 1642. This Pier also offers great of view of harbor,Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan. Main Street :This is developed around 3.5 acres of land with great views of Brooklyn waterfront with the pebble beach,elevated lawns and the environmental education centre, which offers knowledge/education based programmes to school children. On the whole ‘Brooklyn Bridge Park’ is fantastic creation of modern times, providing ; nature/greenery leisure,recreation, entertainment to New Yorkers and its visitors and a definite place to be included in the itinerary.
ReviewTitle: A fantastic creation of modern times, providing ; nature/greenery leisure,recreation,entertainment to great metropolis
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: Cross the Brooklyn bridge on foot and then go to this park ! It's a nice little park, not much to do there really other than enjoy the view and perhaps get some food from one of the street food stall.
ReviewTitle: Nice little park with great view on Manhattan
ProviderLocation: 334 Furman Street , Brooklyn , NY 11201
