ReviewText: Schedule changes daily and there are at least two venues in Manhattan. We git a Sunday night stand up comedy and a Thursday night improv. Both were funny, the stand up has us giggling days later. Inexpensive tickets, some line waiting and small venue once inside. Drinks available, no food.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Check the website and order your tickets as soon as the schedule is posted or you will get sold out!!! I arrived about 45 minutes before the show so I could have a couple drinks first. The adjacent Hot Chicks Bar has microbrews on tap for $5!!!! Yes...$5 craft brew pints in NYC. I snagged a seat at the empty bar but I must have got there just in time because about 5-10 minutes after I was served the place was packed behind me. The comedians were all legit. I laughed so hard I cried. It's a small, intimate, cozy theater and the staff is super friendly, too! Comedians mingle with the audience in the bar after the show, too. $5 for the show and $5 for the drinks...this is an incredible deal and a reallllly good time.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We booked tickets online the day before the show since the earlier show had sold out. We were about 5th in line 1/2 before show. Seating is 1st come/ 1st serve. Our show was a full house, with some folks standing. Small, cozy theater makes it feel very intimate. Improv group was interactive with audience and very funny. Reasonably priced drinks available at the venue. This was a very fun, inexpensive night of fun . Highly recommended
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Make sure you buy tickets in advance. For around $10 US a show you are faced with some of the best comedy acts in the US often featuring writers of Saturday Night live, Late Night with seth Myers, The Daily show and much more! all for the price of a fancy burrito!
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Depending on the night you go, you might laugh harder than you ever have in your entire life! We got a steel cage comedy show down one night, and it's still the funniest live performance I've ever been to. Occasionally, you'll run into a dud, or a comic who's probably really funny at work, or some drunk guys doing improve that think it's going a lot better than the audience actually does, but for the most part, you'll enjoy truly funny people and hilarious jokes and bits.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: UPSIDE: young, daring, super smart improv teams providing 60 minute shows for only $11. Plus, the mystique of Tina Fey and Amy Poehler (founders) add juju and raises expectations. Setting is intimate, a thrust stage and seating capacity of 140 plus 20 standing room. friendly bar prices included wine or beer for $6. DOWNSIDE: Why, why, why were there no people of color and only one woman out of the 8 performers we saw? This doesn't look like a diverse array of talent, and it diminishes the Fey & Poehler association. There are up to 50 bad seats in the house, mostly those closest to the back wall in the 2 side sections. There are 10 or more bad seats in the center section due to a column that obstructs views. We attended the 7:30 and 9:00 PM perfs on Jan. 30 in which both improv teams stayed stage right for a large chunk of time making the closest side section a poor vantage point and probably half of the other side action, too. ADVICE TO MANAGEMENT: you are grossing $1 million-plus annually in ticket revenue alone so either renovate to introduce a proscenium stage or get out of 307 W. 26th. The current facility is a disservice to your business, school, performers and AUDIENCE. Also.....fellow theater and improv lovers, please know that though these improv artists are worth far more than $11 it isn't what you want if sketch comedy or stand-up are what you are looking for. Different animals. Happy theater going.
ReviewTitle: Good, could B Great. Here's How!
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: East Side review - enjoyed the cage match idea of improv - fun to be part of the audience that selected the "winner" of the evening's comedy. Cheap and quality idea for evening activity in city.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We took my parents to see their 'Rumpleteaser Musical Improv' troupe. 'A totally improvised musical' is exactly what we got. The theatre is small and intimate - get there early for some pre-show drinks at their bar. Not sure what to expect, we were blown away by the talent of the performers - so funny, such great singers. A totally improved musical - complete with piano, lights, dance, sound effects...hilarious! For $10 you can attend the one hour performance, or make a night of it and buy tickets for the shows before and afterwards as well. Loved it - can't recommend it highly enough!
ReviewTitle: A phenomenal and memorable night out
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Took me 11 years to get back to see a show here. Wasn't quite as funny as last time, but that's what you get with Improv. Still, it was a great way to spend an evening; especially for $10/ticket. A lot of shows are free and first come/ first serve so check their website. NOTE: The theater is showing it's age. The arm and cup holder on my chair completely fell off when I sat down.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: NOTE: This review is for the East Village location. Visited UCB for their Lloyd Night event - we were standby for the sold out event and managed to get in. We were warned in advance that is may be standing room only but myself and my partner got seats at the back. My partner has good hearing and mine is a bit shoddy in my left but we really struggled to hear some of the troupes. Those that were better at projecting their voices got more laughs from the audience in general as well as ourselves - those that couldn't project or when they were turned away from the front often meant that jokes got lost by the time they reached us at the back. The compere with the guitar had no problem making himself heard, and in general we found the evening enjoyable - just wish we could have heard everything. $5 was a decent price for the experience though, its just frustrating when I feel that the UCB brand is quite a bigged up one. Also, one small issue - found the lock on the toilet doors very dicky!
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Schedule changes daily and there are at least two venues in Manhattan. We git a Sunday night stand up comedy and a Thursday night improv. Both were funny, the stand up has us giggling days later. Inexpensive tickets, some line waiting and small venue once inside. Drinks available, no food.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Check the website and order your tickets as soon as the schedule is posted or you will get sold out!!! I arrived about 45 minutes before the show so I could have a couple drinks first. The adjacent Hot Chicks Bar has microbrews on tap for $5!!!! Yes...$5 craft brew pints in NYC. I snagged a seat at the empty bar but I must have got there just in time because about 5-10 minutes after I was served the place was packed behind me. The comedians were all legit. I laughed so hard I cried. It's a small, intimate, cozy theater and the staff is super friendly, too! Comedians mingle with the audience in the bar after the show, too. $5 for the show and $5 for the drinks...this is an incredible deal and a reallllly good time.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We booked tickets online the day before the show since the earlier show had sold out. We were about 5th in line 1/2 before show. Seating is 1st come/ 1st serve. Our show was a full house, with some folks standing. Small, cozy theater makes it feel very intimate. Improv group was interactive with audience and very funny. Reasonably priced drinks available at the venue. This was a very fun, inexpensive night of fun . Highly recommended
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Make sure you buy tickets in advance. For around $10 US a show you are faced with some of the best comedy acts in the US often featuring writers of Saturday Night live, Late Night with seth Myers, The Daily show and much more! all for the price of a fancy burrito!
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Depending on the night you go, you might laugh harder than you ever have in your entire life! We got a steel cage comedy show down one night, and it's still the funniest live performance I've ever been to. Occasionally, you'll run into a dud, or a comic who's probably really funny at work, or some drunk guys doing improve that think it's going a lot better than the audience actually does, but for the most part, you'll enjoy truly funny people and hilarious jokes and bits.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: UPSIDE: young, daring, super smart improv teams providing 60 minute shows for only $11. Plus, the mystique of Tina Fey and Amy Poehler (founders) add juju and raises expectations. Setting is intimate, a thrust stage and seating capacity of 140 plus 20 standing room. friendly bar prices included wine or beer for $6. DOWNSIDE: Why, why, why were there no people of color and only one woman out of the 8 performers we saw? This doesn't look like a diverse array of talent, and it diminishes the Fey & Poehler association. There are up to 50 bad seats in the house, mostly those closest to the back wall in the 2 side sections. There are 10 or more bad seats in the center section due to a column that obstructs views. We attended the 7:30 and 9:00 PM perfs on Jan. 30 in which both improv teams stayed stage right for a large chunk of time making the closest side section a poor vantage point and probably half of the other side action, too. ADVICE TO MANAGEMENT: you are grossing $1 million-plus annually in ticket revenue alone so either renovate to introduce a proscenium stage or get out of 307 W. 26th. The current facility is a disservice to your business, school, performers and AUDIENCE. Also.....fellow theater and improv lovers, please know that though these improv artists are worth far more than $11 it isn't what you want if sketch comedy or stand-up are what you are looking for. Different animals. Happy theater going.
ReviewTitle: Good, could B Great. Here's How!
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: East Side review - enjoyed the cage match idea of improv - fun to be part of the audience that selected the "winner" of the evening's comedy. Cheap and quality idea for evening activity in city.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: We took my parents to see their 'Rumpleteaser Musical Improv' troupe. 'A totally improvised musical' is exactly what we got. The theatre is small and intimate - get there early for some pre-show drinks at their bar. Not sure what to expect, we were blown away by the talent of the performers - so funny, such great singers. A totally improved musical - complete with piano, lights, dance, sound effects...hilarious! For $10 you can attend the one hour performance, or make a night of it and buy tickets for the shows before and afterwards as well. Loved it - can't recommend it highly enough!
ReviewTitle: A phenomenal and memorable night out
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: Took me 11 years to get back to see a show here. Wasn't quite as funny as last time, but that's what you get with Improv. Still, it was a great way to spend an evening; especially for $10/ticket. A lot of shows are free and first come/ first serve so check their website. NOTE: The theater is showing it's age. The arm and cup holder on my chair completely fell off when I sat down.
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: NOTE: This review is for the East Village location. Visited UCB for their Lloyd Night event - we were standby for the sold out event and managed to get in. We were warned in advance that is may be standing room only but myself and my partner got seats at the back. My partner has good hearing and mine is a bit shoddy in my left but we really struggled to hear some of the troupes. Those that were better at projecting their voices got more laughs from the audience in general as well as ourselves - those that couldn't project or when they were turned away from the front often meant that jokes got lost by the time they reached us at the back. The compere with the guitar had no problem making himself heard, and in general we found the evening enjoyable - just wish we could have heard everything. $5 was a decent price for the experience though, its just frustrating when I feel that the UCB brand is quite a bigged up one. Also, one small issue - found the lock on the toilet doors very dicky!
ProviderLocation: 307 W 26th St , New York City , NY

ReviewText: This sensational gallery is a must for visitors to NYC. Great permanent collections, but the visiting exhibitions I have seen here have also been phenomenal. Very good (pricey) restaurant on site as well.
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: This is a great modern museum and very memorable. The art collection is superb and the curation is also first class. We would visit again.
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: When we arrived the queue was very long for tickets. Luckily, an employee noticed the New York Explorer pass I was holding and directed us to a much shorter queue towards the rear of the hall. It would have been useful if there had been more obvious signs to tell us about this. Despite being very busy, we were till able to see all the exhibits. Some of them are amazing and some leave a lot to the imagination! The building itself is really interesting and we spent a good couple of hours exploring all the exhibition spaces. The cafe we visited was on the 2nd floor. The staff were all very pleasant and welcoming, but the food was definitely overpriced. The menu was also quite limited. The shop had lots of quirky items for sale and is worth a visit even if you do not go into the gallery. This is our second visit here, and we would still come back - hopefully on a dry sunny day when it would be more likely to be quieter!!
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: Sorry, I'm not a big art lover but I did want to see "Starry Night" by Van Gogh. There are some nice paintings and things to see but for the most part I don't see myself ever going back.
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: If you manage just one art gallery with your children in tow, be sure to visit the MOMA... It's easy to navigate and has plenty of wonderful, recognisable pieces that are glorious to observe up close...
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: The most difficult thing about a visit to NYC MOMA is having to leave. Growing up in New York City just north of the "A" Train's last stop - in a liberal household - provided frequent access to fabulous museums - MOMA charged fifty cents and bought me about 6 or 7 hours of riding the Fantasy Express (slowly) through rooms which sheltered some of the world's finest art. A world full of people pore through fat books looking at Van Goghs, Manets, Cezannes, Tookers, Hoppers and Dalis but all I had to do was stroll from room to quiet room- what an adventure! Visited about a year ago with cousin Bruce and although renovated, it holds the same treasures and wonders. I feel blessed having paid MOMA so many visits and I always find it fulfilling, exciting, dazzling and sporting a gift shop which allows taking home memories to share. You GO MOMA!
ReviewTitle: I dream of being a fly on the wall......
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: It is huge and you can easily get lost. We divided and conquered with our two girls age 11 and 14. One loved the suits of armor room and the other loved Greek & Roman statues. Plan to spend at least 3 to 4 hours for just part of the museum.
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: I went to MoMA in a Saturday morning of April 2016, and there was long line for baggage check-in while there's no one waiting for ticket desk. It took around 15 minutes to put my backpack to the cloakroom. (My wife only had a small backpack and she didn't have to.) My advice is, with small or no bag, visitors should spend that amount of waiting time to amuse themselves with the fine art of the world. There're lots of things to see. Enjoy!
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: I am not a fan of crap called 'Modern Art'. Since i am not schooled in 'modern art' where a blank piece of canvas is called art, I did not appreciate this much. Much of the stuff I saw, I could reproduce with some paint from Home Depot. After going through it, I felt that i could also be an artist. Seems like the curators are in a bubble of their own kind, Talent seems to have gone out of the window, and hype has taken over.
ReviewTitle: beauty is in the eye of the beholder
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: This is fantastic display of art- everywhere you look there is another master or modern art phenomena! By the end of our visit I was overwhelmed by what I had seen. A great cafe on the 2nd floor also. This is a must to visit.
ReviewTitle: Overwhelmed by the quality and quantity
ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ProviderLocation: 11 West 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10019

ReviewText: I visit the island everytime i'm in NYC. I found it by accident when i was travelling again and I realized I've seen everything I wanted to see and I was fed up with the crowdy streets and constant noise. My friends laugh that out of all the amazing sights & places i always choose something that's so quiet and mundane. When i first visited, many areas were closed off or under construction, but I can see how this place is getting better year by year. Very scenic, very peaceful. I love the meadows and the old houses. A good place to relax and enjoy some fresh air (well, at least fresher than in the city). There are many activities going on both for adults and children. The free ferry is a plus. The tiny souvernir shop couldn't have been better.
ReviewTitle: Perfect getaway from the crowds & noise
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: Took an afternoon trip over to Governor's Island as an outing for our Lower Manhattan office staff. After a surprisingly short ferry we found ourselves on an oasis just minutes from the hustle and bustle of city life. Attractions include the old fort and museum, however, there are also bike rentals and a number of great open spaces for picnic or relaxing. Most of our office staff of around 40 folks live in the boroughs, but none has visited the island before. We invited family and held a catered lunch on the island for a fun afternoon escape. Note, there are limitations in amenities, so check out their website before heading there.
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: Great getaway by bike and hopping off the ferry here is definitely worth it. If your traveling with kids they will tire quick from all the running around and activities available. Make time during the morning for this island of a gem. And yes starbucks is everywhere.. even here!!
ReviewTitle: Great getaway from the city for the day
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: Go there in the spring and summertime. This place used to be a bustling army base and now sits as a relic. It would be a great place to picnic, walk around, and see the incredible views of lower Manhattan. Every June and August they throw a Jazz Age Lawn Party which harks back to the days of the roaring 20s. I got engaged here!
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: This is just a small patch of land that had the ultimate view of The World Trade Center. You can also see the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island from there.
ReviewTitle: It used to have the greatest view
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: Nice trip with families for picnics, very informative, great views. Spend the entire day there enjoying the history, there is a food court on the island but it may be limited for some people.
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: we flew over it on a helicopter visit, some good history to read up about on it if you like that sort of thing :)
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: I can see the appeal for families who lack green space activities or ability to take a short boat ride, but our trip was unremarkable. The view of the statue of liberty from the water is not nearly as close as the Staten Island Ferry, and most of the buildings on the property did not appear to be tourist ready. Possibly it was still reeling from hurricane Sandy 3 years ago but I've been to many nicer parks, including Central Park a short subway ride away.
ReviewTitle: OK if you've got nothing to do
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: Well if it ain't Governors Island. Well what else can I say. My forefather saw it well before I. They did not leave much information after their visit and I see no need to leave any. Except they do have a database of visits from immigrants.
ReviewTitle: Well if it ain't Governors Island.
ProviderLocation: New York Harbor , Ferry Terminal , New York City , NY 10004

ReviewText: Go in the summer, rent bikes, enjoy some from the food trucks. It's a great spot for a picnic and done peace !

ProviderLocation: 59th to 110th St., from Central Park West to 5th Ave. , Manhattan Borough , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: Having seen central Park In movies and TV shows nothing can quite prepare you for how amazing and massive it really is, it was freezing cold when myself and my wife visited and very quiet but would be packed in the summer. Would recommend
ProviderLocation: 59th to 110th St., from Central Park West to 5th Ave. , Manhattan Borough , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: What a great park! Worlds best! We wandered around for a fair while enjoying the sites and statues. Cold of course but fun too.
ProviderLocation: 59th to 110th St., from Central Park West to 5th Ave. , Manhattan Borough , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: We were blessed with gorgeous sunshine on the day we visited, the trees were in blossom .. Would have loved to have had longer to explore

ReviewText: Central Park is the most beautiful place in NYC and one of the most beautiful parks I have ever visited. It's very huge though, so be prepared to walk a lot or visit more than once!
ProviderLocation: 59th to 110th St., from Central Park West to 5th Ave. , Manhattan Borough , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: A beautiful area in the middle of the city. Definitely a nice way to spend some time with nature and enjoying the New York way of life!
ProviderLocation: 59th to 110th St., from Central Park West to 5th Ave. , Manhattan Borough , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: This is a world class park. 6% of Manhattan in size. There are so many walking paths, bike riding paths, and horse drawn carriages. Definitely plan to spend some time walking around the park. Perhaps you could bring a picnic. There are lots of benches, but sitting on the ground is also a great option. This is a beautiful oasis in the middle of crazy-busy Manhattan.

ReviewText: Oh my. Such a Beautiful place to spend time. So much to see and so much to do. Left the American history Museum and walked directly across the street to the park. There are food vendors at the entrance of the park and we were all pleased with what we ordered. The beautiful trees, flowers, winding roads, bridges etc. make this the perfect place to hang out. This is also great place to people watch. We rented bikes and rode the entire park and it could not have been more fabulous. Our teen said the bike ride through the park is a top favorite of our trip. Tons of places to picnic. Take your camera because I can promise you you will snap lots of photos while you're at this most awesome oasis. Can't wait to go back again.
ProviderLocation: 59th to 110th St., from Central Park West to 5th Ave. , Manhattan Borough , New York City , NY 10022

ReviewText: DUMBO short form for ‘Down under Manhattan Bridge Overpass’ is an expensive Brooklyn / New York neighbourhood located between Manhattan Bridge & Brooklyn Bridge,bordered by ‘Brooklyn Bridge Park’ to the north,’Brooklyn Bridge to the West, ‘Brooklyn Heights’ to the South and ‘Vinegar Hill’ to the East. Walking is the best way to explore DUMBO and this neighbourhood offers; premium residential accommodations, restaurants serving best shrimps & pork dishes and one of the best place serving Lobsters (Luke’S Lobster), pizzerias (famous one being grimaldi’s),ice creams (served by Brooklyn Ice Factory),the best chocolate served by Jacques Torres,some of the best croissants served by bakery almandine, branded & non- branded clothes, technology companies, entertainments (Jane’s Carousel), performing arts centres (great shows are organised at St.Ann’s Warehouse) and for music lovers, there is an unusual place floating in the river, bargemusic music, a beautiful concert hall. DUMBO is a central hub to start the great walk or bike over the Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan Bridge or proceed to the beautiful Neighbourhood of Brooklyn Bridge Park (Pier-1 to Pier-6,Fulton Ferry Landing), offering a variety of leisure,recreation, entertainment and fantastic views of Manhattan, which will force one to click your favourite photos. A definite place to enjoy; good food,best of recreation,lot of relaxation and best of views.
ReviewTitle: PLace for good Food,best of recreation,lot of relaxation and best of views.
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: This is a fun place to visit not only because of the restaurants and coffee shops, but also because there are lots of interesting stores that you won't find elsewhere. You can easily spend an afternoon having lunch, then browsing the stores, then having a snack at a coffee shop, then doing some more browsing. Parking can be a challenge, so arrive by subway if possible.
ReviewTitle: Lots of interesting shops and restaurants
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: Charming city. I enjoyed a lot walking by those streets and watching every single view of this beautiful place.
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: If you want to try something different than the usual Manhattan shopping area you may try DUMBO. Many coffee bars and interesting shops and on saturdays there is a small flea market that worth a short visit.
ReviewTitle: Nice area for a short visit!
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: Dumbo is a great little place to walk and see the river. Under Brooklyn Bridge there is a small beach and lots of restaurants including a ice cream factory.
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: As we went to DUMBO on our own and just walked around maybe the reason this was not an enjoyable experience. We just did not get it.
ReviewTitle: Not sure what the draw is
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: LOCATED IN MINUTES FROM BROOKLYN EXIT FROM BROOKLYN BRIDGE BY FOOT! RIGHT IN DOWNTOWN OF BROOKLYN. Nearby Brooklyn Bridge Park, Historical buoldings of Cadman Plaza West, including Historical Borough Hall, Court Building, Old Post Office, several first high-rises in Brooklyn of 1920s. DUMBO IS A COLLECTION OF OLD ART SHOPS, RESTAURANTS AND EXPENSIVE CONDOS, BROOKLYN PROMENADE IS A FREE, AND CHEAP EAST RIVER FERRY TO Williamsburg, Hunters Point and Manhattan. Close to all subway lines served Borough of Brooklyn, all but one line, G, going to Manhattan, you could stroll to there by Brooklyn Bridge for best skyline views, for free.
ReviewTitle: DUMBO, or Down Under Manhattan Bridge Overpass, area for skyline watchers, expensive restaurants and condos, ferry stop
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: We visited the DUMBO after we were at ground zero. Subway was very easy and only couple stops. Do not bother taking taxi because it'll be expensive paying the toll. If you are using subway a lot, there is the 7 day unlimited ride for $30. Single ride is $2.75 so $30 is quite easy to break even. Because subway has many lines, when you are in the subway, make certain you are at the right platform. The first time we were in the subway, waiting for line 6, we saw so many Q, and S trains came by but no 6. Waited 20 minutes, and finally realized, we had to follow the plat form and go to a lower level.... walk about another 5 minutes to get to the line 6 platform. Back to DUMBO. DUMBO is a little area under Brooklyn bridge. It has many hip stores, and quite quaint. There is also a small play ground and park near by the river. The Ferris Wheel was closed. Kids had a great time just throwing rocks on the river side. Crossing the bridge is fun too. Then we found Juliana's Pizza close by. It was worth the walk. After pizza, subway is quite close by, it was convenient and safe. (we left around 7:45pm) If you have time, this is a cool place to see.
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: A must visit on any trip to NYC. Beautiful views of downtown Manhattan and of the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridge. There are so many good places to eat
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: Dumbo is a cool area with a great view of Manhattan and Brooklyn bridge. There are many awesome and funky restaurants in the area and there is an antique store called "shibui". It's a Japanese antique store owned by Dane and he has a great eye for the stuff and the display is amazing! A great area to walk around!
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: DUMBO short form for ‘Down under Manhattan Bridge Overpass’ is an expensive Brooklyn / New York neighbourhood located between Manhattan Bridge & Brooklyn Bridge,bordered by ‘Brooklyn Bridge Park’ to the north,’Brooklyn Bridge to the West, ‘Brooklyn Heights’ to the South and ‘Vinegar Hill’ to the East. Walking is the best way to explore DUMBO and this neighbourhood offers; premium residential accommodations, restaurants serving best shrimps & pork dishes and one of the best place serving Lobsters (Luke’S Lobster), pizzerias (famous one being grimaldi’s),ice creams (served by Brooklyn Ice Factory),the best chocolate served by Jacques Torres,some of the best croissants served by bakery almandine, branded & non- branded clothes, technology companies, entertainments (Jane’s Carousel), performing arts centres (great shows are organised at St.Ann’s Warehouse) and for music lovers, there is an unusual place floating in the river, bargemusic music, a beautiful concert hall. DUMBO is a central hub to start the great walk or bike over the Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan Bridge or proceed to the beautiful Neighbourhood of Brooklyn Bridge Park (Pier-1 to Pier-6,Fulton Ferry Landing), offering a variety of leisure,recreation, entertainment and fantastic views of Manhattan, which will force one to click your favourite photos. A definite place to enjoy; good food,best of recreation,lot of relaxation and best of views.
ReviewTitle: PLace for good Food,best of recreation,lot of relaxation and best of views.
ProviderLocation: Brooklyn , NY 11201

ReviewText: Well preserved bit of history where a famous author had lived, at this scenic site in the "forgotten Borough"... ===Visit was prior to April 2015 ===
ReviewTitle: An historic house on Staten Island
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: Once upon a time, a 100-yr-before-her-time, liberated woman lived in this house perched on the NYC Harbor as the first greeting point for ships entering here. She was a goofy-fun individual, as you can tell if you visit the house and view her photos taken throughout her world. And the house is dazzling, as are its views.
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: I was very impressed with the tour and the photos and history.Worth a t trip especially for a native Staten Islander
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: On our first ever visit to Staten Island, we discovered,on line, the Alice Austen House and decided to make a visit the centre of our day. We could not have made a better choice, the house is a treasure trove of information and exhibits relating to Ms Austen, a photographer well ahead of her time in many ways who deserves to be more well know. There is an excellent and informative film, ideal as a background to start the tour and much else to see. The setting could not be better, running down to the shore with views across to Manhattan. Additionally, a big "Thank You" to the staff for being so welcoming and adding to our day. A memorable experience. Highly recommended
ReviewTitle: The Highlight Of Our Visit To Staten Island
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: I grew up on Staten Island and had heard great things about this place. I finally made the trip to Rosebank to see it and it exceeded my expectations. The property of the Alice Austen House is beautiful, with wonderful views of the city. I loved learning about Alice Austen and viewing her life work. I'm obsessed with Victorian history and culture and early photography, so this place was right up my alley. I highly recommend it for those visiting Staten Island.
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: A wonderful way to spend time in Staten Island. The museum is full of interesting information about the history of the house, about Alice live and her work. The dark room on second floor, which Alice used to make pictures, is well preserved. The museum staff is very informed. Plenty of street parking around. Worth a visit.
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: Clear Comfort started out as a modest 1690's Dutch farmhouse to become the Victorian Gothic home to early American photographer Alice Austen(1866-1952). Rooms were added at different times. The house overlooks NY Harbor and skyline of NYC. It's located on the eastern shore of Staten Island. The house is at 2 Hylan.Open Tuesday-Sunday 11 am - 5 pm. $3 suggested donation. Blvd
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: Great escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Lovely gardens. Bring lawnchairs or a picnic basket and sit on the grass to enjoy views of the beach and the bridge. Lots of photo opportunities. Museum is small but worthwhile. Affordable! Suggested donation of $3
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: When I lived near by I would always to to events here. This place is neat. Nice little house large grounds.
ReviewTitle: The little house with big ideas
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: Most people taking the Staten Island ferry just seem to visit St George and head back to Manhattan - or worse, just turn back without even visiting the port, merely to say they've done it and - hey! - seen the Statue of Liberty quite close up. There is far, far more to NYC than Manhattan, but maybe I should keep that secret. Oh yeah, the Alice Austen house: a warm welcome awaits, this is a superb old house with lovely photos, it's a very calm world away from the (admittedly wonderful too) insanity across the water, and they suggest that each visitor pay a mere $3! And don't forget to visit the Alice Austen grave at Moravian Cemetery near Grant City and just a few minutes from the train station if you're using public transport - but go to the lobby of the restroom first to get (free) printouts of the cemetery and the location of the grave itself.
ReviewTitle: Well worth going out of the way for
ProviderLocation: 2 Hylan Blvd. , Staten Island , NY 10305

ReviewText: An amazing dance studio, with great instructors! My friend recommended Dance Reverie for dance classes for our wedding. We purchased a groupon and took a few group classes and one private class - and since then had purchased a 10 private classes. Firstly the price is very fair. The teachers are extremely professionals so you can feel very comfortable working with them. We have trained with different instructors and they are all amazing, patient and have taught us a great moves. We have another 3-4 classes and our dance already is coming along great. Not only are we learning how to move but we are also having an amazing time. I would highly recommend it!
ProviderLocation: 100-35 Metropolitan Ave , Forest Hills , NY 11375

ReviewText: An amazing dance studio, with great instructors! My friend recommended Dance Reverie for dance classes for our wedding. ProviderLocation: 100-35 Metropolitan Ave , Forest Hills , NY 11375

ReviewText: Great time from the second we walked in- went to the 2pm show- bring some extra money for the medieval swag they sell- daughter got a headband and my son hit a sword and shield-$40 for it all- wife started with a glass of wine- plenty to see for the hour + before they let you in. We paid the upgrade for the royalty package which put us in the 3'rd row in a section all by ourselves which was great!!!! Food was surprisingly great! From soup to Apple pastry. Show was mesmerizing and great action- 2 hours of cheering and absorbing all the action- kids loved it!!!! Set one was great- highly recommend and we will go back- only negative comment is the cost- got 4 tickets from groupon and still with all the drinks/ swag/ tips eye run the 4 of us close to $350 but still a great time.
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: This place is great. We got there late due to traffic but we still got great seats! Grabbed a quick beer and went in. Food was awesome. Kids loved it and can't wait to go back.
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: Despite how this event is designed to give you an entertaining event while sucking the money out of you, it works because you will still have a good time. Screaming and yelling for you knight to win is super fun. Of course before the show they pack you into the main lobby with plenty of opportunities to buy souveniers, drinks and photos with the king. Try not to fall for any of it (despite the plea from our goddaughters), and you will still have a good time. Also, no need to upgrade to better seats as even the nosebleeds have good views. My only issue is that the event is a little male-centric (I know, it is jousting) but the princess wasn't that involved so it would have been nice to see more of that. There are plenty of coupons out there so you should never have to pay full price. Our chicken was pleasantly tasty. Worth the price if you can keep from spending too much while there.
ReviewTitle: Can't help having a good time
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: Family fun and fantasy all under one roof. Prices are not cheap, look for a Groupon if you can, but you do get a large meal,(tomato soup, toasted bread, half roast chicken, corn on the cobb, half of a baked potato, an apple puff for desert and all the Pepsi you can drink. Beer and wine extra), free parking and a choice of experience level depending on your price range. I would not recommend spending the money for preferred seating unless you really want to be down front. There's honestly not a bad seat in the house as long as you get there ahead of time. The show is wonderful with expert horsemanship and a great sense of fantasy, it's really fun for all ages, but I might recommend the little ones be above 5 since the show is a good 2 hours long with lots of noise. Bring cash or plastic since the kids will want every light up toy and costume there is. Please note, the theme is Medieval, so there are NO UTENSILS, you use your hands to eat with, just an FYI.
ReviewTitle: Family Fun Fantasy, Great rainy day indoor fun.
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: Great night for the children. The atmosphere of the medieval spectacle is contagious. You and your family become immersed in the tournament. The food is perfect for the show. You are not going to leave stuffed, but if you went there to fill up you got on the wrong horse.
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: Very entertaining! Dinner was fabulous, the dessert was the best apple turnover I have ever had. And the show was really good. Be prepared to spend more money after the admission fee. They have souvenir counters, photo packages, and even a museum of medieval torture. In addition, you can pay extra to have a member of your party knighted, or their birthday announced during the show. And alcohol is not included in the admission fee.
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: What is this sickeningly sweet potion they called "pepsi"; from where did the King find this deadly red fruit his cooks turned into "tomato" soup; there was this tasty root called "potato" and a sweet grain they said was "corn"; I recognized the chicken and done beautifully it was; and the tall glasses of ale and mead were warmly received; but those other items have never been seen before in this medieval old world. ..perhaps they come from some undiscovered new lands that only the King and his magicians and warlocks know. Regardless, listen not to the nattering nabobs of negativism, dinner was delicious, the show was marvelous, and the crowd was unruly and uproarious as they should be. Bravo! We'll be back! Special thanks to the brave Knights and their valiant steeds, who fought much harder and realistically than we expected!
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: Good & Meal & Good Show It is a fun place for both kids & adults. The show is entertaining and exciting
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: The entertainment was cheesy but fun. I think the knights did a great job of getting us involved. It was fun standing up and yelling for my favorite knight. I thought our knight was the best, fastest and most skilled, but he eventually lost out at the end of the tournament. There is nothing like a night of jousting and sword fighting. I'm not sure if we need to go back but it was worth it one time for sure. The food was adequate enough considering how you were entertained.
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: This is great spot for a night out if you are looking for something a little different. You get your knight that you cheer for and off you go. You only need to hold back a bit in this kid friendly atmosphere. The skills competitions are cool to watch, the horses are interesting, and the overall entertainment is there. I'm not sure if we need to go back but it was a fun night out. As for the food it was OK. I don't think this is a place you go for the food so I thought it was adequate enough. Soup, half chicken, small potato, corn, bread, and drinks.
ProviderLocation: 149 Polito Ave , Lyndhurst , NJ 07071

ReviewText: There's something about Coney Island that's just unique. Getting out of the train here when coming from Manhattan feels like stepping in a completely different world. Be it during crowded summer days or the very quiet winter days, Coney Island always has a different flavour. Come here and enjoy a walk, eat a hot dog, or just sit and watch the ocean and the people.
ReviewTitle: Always good for a day out of the big city.
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: Coney Island What a fantastic contrast Coney Island was to the hustle and bustle of New York. We caught the subway out to Coney Island and was amazed at how beautiful the beach was. We are from Australia and pride ourselves on our beautiful Beaches so we thought Coney Island beach was okay. We didn't realise that nothing really opened u til later in the day so we Simply walked up and down the pier admiring the place. We found a great bar (Ruby's Bar) to buy hot chocolates from and purchased hotdogs from Nathan's. At 12 Luna park opened up and by this stage there were more people about. I'm glad we made the effort to come out to Coney Island because it shows that there is more to NY than just Times Square.
ReviewTitle: A nice escape from the city
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: We have been coming to NYC for years but have always stayed in the city, seeing shows, taking in the sights, shopping etc. This visit we decided to do something different so we hopped on the subway down to Coney Island. It was about an hour's ride but for $3 each you can't complain! It was a cold day and I believe Coney Island had just opened for the season so it wasn't too busy but I can imagine on a warm summer's day, it would be a very different experience. The kids (and several adults) easily blew through $220 riding a few of the coasters so I can also imagine that you could spend a small fortune if you were here for an extended period of time! Still our kids had a great time and enjoyed riding the Cyclone. We also managed to take a stroll along the boardwalk which was fabulous. The beach looked lovely but it was too cold to even contemplate taking a paddle. We will definitely return here, hopefully on a warmer day but probably not during the busy summer months.
ReviewTitle: Great Afternoon Away From The City...
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: I have lived in a Coney Island area for more than 2 decades and I thank my goodness gracious for allowing me to settle down here. I typically run on the boardwalk quite often and I love how rapidly things are changing for the better!! it is a place like no other in NYC.. a true gem and a MUST-SEE
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: We took the train to Coney Island (around an hour from Manhattan) and spent the day on the beach, sipping margaritas and waling the boardwalk. It was a really hot day so the beach was packed but the atmosphere was great. Make sure you try out the famous Wonder Wheel for amazing views! A must for anyone visiting NY in summer!
ReviewTitle: A great day out of the City
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: It's just amazing to be able to go to the beach from Manhattan by metro. The beach itself is pretty nice, very wide. There is a nice boardwalk with lots of little shops and restaurants.
ReviewTitle: Nice beach you can go to by metro
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: What can be said this is one of the classic places in NYC to see. The history is difficult since there is not much left of the original but still worth going to. What's better then a Nathan's hot dog and a ride on the Cyclone.
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: Various opportunities. From Free to pay as you go. Walk the boardwalk. Jog, bike. Play on the beach. Fly a kite. All for free. Coney Island has amusement parks, food places, aquarium, handball courts. Take in baseball with Brooklyn Cyclones. Ice skating ring nearby. Easy access to subway or park car.
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: I had expected a little more. It more for kids and I guess I felt a little too old to enjoy myself to the fullest. Everything is pretty expensive so you need to be prepared for it. I would say you need to see it for yourself. I liked the space and I am happy I went to see for myself.
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: I have been going to Coney Island since my parents were taking in the at age 6 and now at 54 i still going but for different events. The new LUNA company rides are nice and the cyclone is still king in my book. During the summer months their great music played by professional D-Jays and that's when and where I get my Nathan's frogs legs. There are other wonderful attractions nearby as well and it still great for children of all ages hint,hint.
ProviderLocation: Surf Ave , Brooklyn , NY 11224

ReviewText: There's something about Coney Island that's just unique. Getting out of the train here when coming from Manhattan feels like stepping in a completely different world. Be it during crowded summer days or the very quiet winter days, Coney Island always has a different flavour. Come here and enjoy a walk, eat a hot dog, or just sit and watch the ocean and the people.

ReviewText: I grew up with this institution as it was my mothers favorite site. It is a fabulous place to learn, experience and enjoy. It is a must see!
ProviderLocation: 17603 Jamaica Avenue , Jamaica , NY 11432

ReviewText: I heard about the Afrikan Poetry Theatre through the online wikipedia and am so glad to have visited this Very Special Place today! During my visit, I met with Saiku Branch, the program director who told me that the place was founded by John Watusi Branch, his father 38 years ago and at the theater, they offer many classes and events such as Poetry Readings, Spoken Words/Arts, they have dance classes, piano classes, open mikes, live bands and even offer free drum classes on tuesdays from 5:30 pm - 8:30 pm. I was very much impressed with what I saw on the walls with their various photographs and works of art, along with what I heard For even more information, please visit their website at: afrikanpoetrytheatre.org
ReviewTitle: I Like The Afrikan Poetry Theatre Very, Very Much!
ProviderLocation: 17603 Jamaica Avenue , Jamaica , NY 11432

ReviewText: We went for the annual Orchid Show at perhaps the best time of the year. Trees were flowering everywhere in pale pinks and whites, the meadows dotted with buttercups and daffodils, and the huge variety of orchids inside the Conservatory masterfully displayed. There are special exhibits at other times of the year also, like the roses in summer, and even if not these gardens are a gem not to miss when visiting or living in New York City. Admission to the grounds only is more reasonably priced, but it does not include special exhibits or the tram that goes around the grounds and has a guided tour. At Christmas, they have the holiday train show where reservations are a must. It features model trains traveling around New York area buildings and landmarks all made out of natural plants. It is spectacular also.
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: Worth the trip. A short commuter train ride from Grand Central Station in Manhattan right to the entrance to the gardens. So much to see. There is a tram to ride through the zones to connect the gardens, or you can get a good hike going from the rock area, the more natural zones, the tailored rose garden, the large connected indoor conservatory with gardens and ponds around it, or seeing the tree forest area. Great casual food spots with indoor or outdoor eating areas at the cafe. And there is an indoor museum. So worth the trip. Plan at least 4-6 hours to see it. I should have arrived when they opened, there was enough to see to spend the entire day 10-6.
ReviewTitle: Expansive Botanical Gardens w/ tram, huge conservatory, and several natural garden areas
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: Visited on a cold windy day. The indoor orchid display was nice. The varieties were repeated frequently in different areas of the conservatory. Enjoyed Longwood Gardens OrKids Days better. Took the tram ride around the property. Learned from narration May till the fall is the premium time to to visit. Come when the weather is pleasant. Was frozen after the tram ride. Walked awhile in azalea garden to warm up but limited foliage in the garden. Loved the gift shop. Would love to visit again when weather is better to see if my opinions change.
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: I visited here with two friends on a cloudy, warmish spring day. We had to park across the street which is not very convenient if you have a handicapped person with you, which we did. Even so, the walk to the entrance of the gardens and then on to the conservatory was short. The entrance fee is very fair considering all that these gardens have to offer. We went to see the annual Orchidelirium. Not only do you get to enjoy numerous varieties of orchids from around the world but you get to experience a rain forest and a desert among other biomes. The room with the fountain and waterlily pond is an unexpectedly joyful highlight of the garden. The day we went, which was midday on a Thursday, was perfect. There had been some school groups there but they seemed to be leaving by the time we arrived. I got to take many photos of flowers and plants which is one of my favorite things to do. All in all, it was an exceptionally enjoyable day trip.
ReviewTitle: A place where you can fill up your soul with beauty.
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: It was really great to return after the long dreary winter to the New York Botanical Garden. We headed out early this morning to see ORCHIDELIRIUM, the latest (14th) version of the annual orchid show they hold there. Many vibrant colors of flowers were in the various indoor gardens, and even though we've been to the site numerous times, we always feel we are seeing new things. The flowers grow differently each year after all! We also rode on the tram to see the magnolia trees in bloom. It was cool and windy, but the sun came out, so we had pretty much the perfect day to be outdoors. Now we get to celebrate a second time with this selection of photos! Hope you like them.
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: What a beautiful garden. Breathtaking and educational. A great place to visit , relax, and learn This is a wonderful visit for families and friends. We saw the Orchid show which is spectacular Take the train to get there. Easy
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: As usual the orchids were spectacular. Luckily it did not rain as predicted, we got to walk the entire park. The daffodils & magnolias were beautiful.
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: Went there twice for the Orchid Shows. The place is elegantly managed and an amusement to be in. The staff in gift shop are amazing- Ebony went out of her way to help my daughter with her cactus selection and brought back her iPad left at checkout. Thank you for making it such a memorable experience!
ReviewTitle: Orchid show and so much more
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: After all exelent reviews we were very dissapointed. It is not so far good orchid show. Yes, there are blooming orchids, but seems like any regular blooming in the botanical garden. We`ve been twice to DC orchid show, one was The Orchid Symphony-that was awesome.
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: This is such a beautiful sight seeing place. There is so much to see and so many colors. nicest arrangements as well. its not just plants and flowers only. a must see if you in the area
ProviderLocation: 2900 Southern Blvd , Bronx , NY 10458

ReviewText: First time to the Tavern and for a concert! It was beautiful! No electricity, no running water and a wood burning stove for heat! (hint -- use restrooms in Richmondtown at before the concert!) They do sell some beverages, the monies going to Richmondtown (as well as the ticket fees. 2nd hint: buy tickets in advance, tavern is small and they do turn people away, as witnessed!) All wooden tables and benches, seating was community style. Very intimate with sconces for lighting. Wonderful throwback in time! A 'must' to do at least once! Ample free parking in Richmondtown Parking Lot -- a little hike to the Tavern on Richmond Road. We have not gone to Richmondtown for a tour, review is for Tavern Concert Series. Enjoy!!!
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: Great little place to go for a history lesson about America in the 1800's they have people dressed in clothes from that time and they have a country fair for labor day week and pumpkin picking in October and a Christmas tree lighting in December and about 10 old house that you can walk through with people making food and candlestick and a wood working shop just like in the 1800's John
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: It is better when there are events going on, but this is historic nonetheless ! There needs to be more Ferry advertising about Historic Richmondtown events, so as to promote what it has to offer...
ReviewTitle: Better when there are events going on, but historic nonetheless !
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: We went for pumpkin picking and had s great time. Enjoyed a hay ride, corn maze but missed the ponies that day. Beer is cold and refreshments are available. Reasonably priced
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: As an active member of Historic Richmond Town, I make several trips to the Tavern for music, and many trips to take visitors on tours. Each visit enlightens not only visitors but also myself. Every season has its own revelations. Spring awakenings, summer BBQ's, Fall pumpkin pickin' and Halloween party and even winter surprises in the Tavern and just keeping warm inside the museum and courthouse. This is a must see for everyone. Kids, teens, adults all will find something interesting, educational, and just plain fun! Do not miss this gem.
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: I go very often! It's a beautiful little area! Many tours are available and many events take place! It is usually over looked but it's a great area!
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: Travelled all the way from Brooklyn to Staten Island to see historic Richmond town only to get to the island and find it CLOSED. really ? Closed over the busiest tourist time of the year!? What a joke
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: Right in our own back yard...,earn about the first families of Staten Island and see where they lived...went to school and worked...from the General store to the blacksmith..its an interesting place.
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: I highly recommend Richmond Town to everyone interested in history and historical preservation. You don't have to leave New York City or even Staten Island to see it.
ReviewTitle: My trip to Historic Richmond Town
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: One of Staten Island's unique attractions, Historic Richmondtown features historical buildings that trace the Island's history from the late 17th Century to the mid 20th Century. Have been visiting the site since 1969 and seen it change dramatically with restorations ongoing. My tour group enjoyed a delicious luncheon at Bennett's Cafe.
ReviewTitle: A little bit of SI History
ProviderLocation: 441 Clarke Avenue , Staten Island , NY 10306

ReviewText: Kasser Theater is the home of varied performances from chorales to ballet to drama. My most recent visit was for a dress rehearsal for "The Altzheimer's Stories. The music and singing were superb and very emotional.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: This is a beautiful theater with college play productions and local and/or international artistic performances. I attended a musical production of a local playwright and enjoyed the many musical songs and costumes in this musical production. The cost is reasonable priced for students and senior citizens. Please review Montclair State University for coming production and cost for the holidays and 2016 year.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: For $20 per ticket one can see top performance groups, ranging from Bill T Jones to the Shanghai String Quartet. Every seat is comfortable with good views of the stage. The acoustics are top notch. There is parking adjacent to the theater building. We go multiple times a year. The student productions ($15) are also excellent.
ReviewTitle: Kasser provides top notch, inexpensive performacnes
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: The Alexander Kasser Theater, on the campus of Montclair State University is a wonderful performance arts space and a cultural site to attend. It seats only 500 and is intimate and warm. The sound and lighting was perfect for a dance evening in October. The Peak Performance series for 2014/15 is in full swing and many fine national artists and troupes are on the bill. Parking is abundant and attached to the space. The campus is beautiful and the staff were helpful and friendly. The University is located in Upper Montclair, NJO and is easily accessed from Route 46 in Great Notch. A venue to get to know better.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: We feel so fortunate to have this beautiful. comfortable theater located so close to us. Not only is it comparable to NYC theaters, but there are always buses from there coming to performances. The prices are low and the many types of shows being put on are interesting and different. I highly recommend that you look over their upcoming programs and attend as many as you can.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: This is a very comfortable theater with great sight lines and very good acoustics. The only slight negative is while the parking is next to the theater in the parking deck, if the event is at the same time as university classes, traffic can be a challenge.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: A great addition to the campus of Montclair State University. Have attended many different events at the theater and it has always been a very pleasant experience.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: Gave a lecture here to a group of about 350. Theater is very modern, very comfortable, and appears to have reasonable acoustics. It is certainly a nice addition to the MSU campus.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: Great venue! You can see and hear well from any of the seats. The parking garage (Red Hawk Deck) is attached, so it’s perfect no matter what the weather. You don’t have to walk far, and it’s always beautiful, clean and comfortable. I would recommend it for any event;dance, music, movie, lecture or play. While you’re on the MSU campus, depending on the day and time also check out the Segal Art Gallery just next door to the theatre and also accessible by the 4th floor of the parking deck.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: Performances are regularly reviewed and praised in the New York Times. Prices are generally a flat $15 for any seat in the house, almost all of which are really good. Mostly cutting edge or unusual productions of music, performance pieces, dance and some theater are the staples, with consummate professionals doing the performing. The Shanghai Quartet is a twice-a-year regular, mixing the usual classical repertoire with modern pieces and occasional Chinese guests. I would venture to say that this theater is worth a detour from almost anywhere.
ReviewTitle: New York Quality Over the River
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: Kasser Theater is the home of varied performances from chorales to ballet to drama. My most recent visit was for a dress rehearsal for "The Altzheimer's Stories. The music and singing were superb and very emotional.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: This is a beautiful theater with college play productions and local and/or international artistic performances. I attended a musical production of a local playwright and enjoyed the many musical songs and costumes in this musical production. The cost is reasonable priced for students and senior citizens. Please review Montclair State University for coming production and cost for the holidays and 2016 year.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: For $20 per ticket one can see top performance groups, ranging from Bill T Jones to the Shanghai String Quartet. Every seat is comfortable with good views of the stage. The acoustics are top notch. There is parking adjacent to the theater building. We go multiple times a year. The student productions ($15) are also excellent.
ReviewTitle: Kasser provides top notch, inexpensive performacnes
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: The Alexander Kasser Theater, on the campus of Montclair State University is a wonderful performance arts space and a cultural site to attend. It seats only 500 and is intimate and warm. The sound and lighting was perfect for a dance evening in October. The Peak Performance series for 2014/15 is in full swing and many fine national artists and troupes are on the bill. Parking is abundant and attached to the space. The campus is beautiful and the staff were helpful and friendly. The University is located in Upper Montclair, NJO and is easily accessed from Route 46 in Great Notch. A venue to get to know better.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: We feel so fortunate to have this beautiful. comfortable theater located so close to us. Not only is it comparable to NYC theaters, but there are always buses from there coming to performances. The prices are low and the many types of shows being put on are interesting and different. I highly recommend that you look over their upcoming programs and attend as many as you can.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: This is a very comfortable theater with great sight lines and very good acoustics. The only slight negative is while the parking is next to the theater in the parking deck, if the event is at the same time as university classes, traffic can be a challenge.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: A great addition to the campus of Montclair State University. Have attended many different events at the theater and it has always been a very pleasant experience.
ProviderLocation: Montclair State University , Montclair , NJ 07043

ReviewText: Gave a lecture here to a group of about 350. Theater is very modern, very comfortable, and appears to have reasonable acoustics. It is certainly a nice addition to the MSU campus.

ReviewText: I think its a pretty nice farm, it was a nice touch adding the sale of bbq corn on the cob. I do however feel the gift shop prices were a bit pricey. everything else was great maybe if they bring down the prices alittle they would bring in more customers and on a consistant basis.
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: They have many special events geared for children. There are also hay rides and animals that you can feed for a small price at the gift shop. My grandson loves the place.
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: My kids attended many events at the "farm". Now I bring my grandkids. The spring and fall events are the best. Admission is very reasonable and occasionally free. The yearly Indian Pow-Wow in late July is great.
ReviewTitle: A neighborhood farm to bring kids
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: This is a great place if you or your kids like farm animals. We went on 'Wildlife Weekend.' There were pony rides for kids, hayrides,shows with a hedgehog and a chinchilla, a birds of prey show,feeding the farm animals, milking a cow,tours of the historic farmhouse from 1772, a sandbox full of corn kernels and trucks for the kids and a tractor for them to climb on. It's great we have this in NYC.
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: When you live in the city but what to show the kids a real cow, pig or sheep, this is the place to go. Very convenient, small and fun. Special events are worth checking out but they are open just about everyday for a short walk around the farm. You can buy fresh eggs and vegetables in season at the little store. Parking on the street is available.
ReviewTitle: A local farm to bring the kids
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: animals are interesting for kids especially they also have activities for kids some of the produce, etc they sell is expensive
ReviewTitle: not a bad trip for kids
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: My husband and I visited earlier this month after I discovered they had a pumpkin patch. It was a bit of a pain to get to on public transport but it was worth it. There is so much to see in addition to the pumpkin patch; the maize maze, animals and petting zoo, hayride and the Adriance Farm House, that you can tour. The prices were reasonable, ranging from $3-5 per activity. There are also food stalls so you can get a snack. A lot of places are *cash only* so make sure you have money with you. There were so many pumpkins! Even as an adult I was excited, so kids will love it, as well as all the animals. I would give the hayride a miss, we lined up for quite a while for essentially two loops of the car park. It is a bumpy ride and you don't really see anything. We didn't do the maze, but it looked loads of fun. We toured the farm house, which was around 45 mins, I would say only do this if you have time after everything else, as there are only 3 rooms to see and the commentary can be a bit slow, but 'Mister Marty' is really nice and knowledgeable about the farm. There is also a little farm shop that is worth a look, where you can buy eggs. It is a fun day out for adults and families. I plan to go back next October to do it all again.
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: We go to the Maize Maze every year in October. It's a great family activity and lots of fun. They have the maze set up in a different pattern each year and it's really well done. It's funny to keep passing the same people, all of us trying to find our way to the next puzzle piece. The employees are young and enthusiastic. There is a DJ talking into a microphone interviewing those who made it to the exit that broadcasts to the people in the maze so it's entertaining (except for the kids who shout into the mic!). There was a great band playing in one of the buildings and a mildly haunted house in another building. There is a pumpkin patch, a cider stand, and a small gift shop. There are animals that can be fed and petted. This is a great place for a family day out in the fall. Parking is free and the lot is huge. Bus stops right outside the gate.
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: We went pumpkin picking and there was a lot of fun and things to do. The maze was super fun !!! The hayride not so much... Feeding the animals and the pony ride was great. You get to enjoy a day in the farm inside the city !!!
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129

ReviewText: From Seasonal events like spook house, corn maze, Farm Fresh Food (Vegetables, eggs and bee honey) this is a worthwhile trip. You have to see some of the special events, from Pow Wows, carnivals, and seasonal attractions, there is always something to do
ProviderLocation: 73-50 Little Neck Parkway , Floral Park , NY 11004-1129
